description: Red cherry fruit comes laced with light tannins, giving this bright wine an open, juicy character.
title: Domaine de la Madone 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a festive wine, with soft, ripe fruit and acidity, plus a red berry flavor.
title: Henry Fessy 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a generous, ripe wine that's full of juicy red-cherry fruits and gentle tannins. It has some richness, giving a sweet character to this open, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

description: This is a dense wine, packed with both tannins and acidity. It brings out the ageworthiness of this appellation with its rich potential and dark mineral texture. Drink this concentrated cru wine from 2018.
title: Henry Fessy 2015  Juliénas

description: The wine comes from one of the cru estates followed by this negociant house. It is a light, ripe and fruity wine. With its attractive red-berry flavors, finished with crisp acidity, it is accessible and ready to drink.
title: Henry Fessy 2015  Régnié

description: Produced from cru vines at the base of Mount Brouilly, the wine has structure as well as ripe black-plum fruits. It is generous and its fruit is well balanced by acidity and solid tannins. The wines is ready to drink.
title: Pardon et Fils 2015 Les Quartelets  (Brouilly)

description: Produced from vineyards donated to a charitable hospital in the 19th century, this wine is rich and now perfectly mature. It has smoky tannins that lie under the fine, elegant cherry and red plum fruits and acidity. The wine still has freshness although the attraction here is the ripe structure. The ornate label dates back to 1926.
title: Collin-Bourisset 2011 Hospices Civils de Romanèche Thurins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This is a firm wine, balancing some solid tannins with ripe red fruits. Still young, it is packed with fruitiness and with acidity that are centered around a firm core. Drink this stylish wine from 2018.
title: Domaine Franck Besson 2014 Le Griottier  (Juliénas)

description: The wine is warm and round, full of ripe berry fruits and soft tannins. It's ready to drink now with its full structure, balanced acidity and juicy aftertaste.
title: Les Vins Aujoux 2013 Belle Grâce  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Crisp while also fruity, it has bright acidity, lively citrus and apple flavors and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Thulon 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Some wood aging gives the fruitiness of the wine an added spice. Tannins support the bitter cherry flavors and add firmness to the juicy acidity. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Domaine du Haut-Poncié 2013 Roche Grès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: The wine is very fresh, with intense acidity and fragrant red fruits. Made from 100-year-old vines, it's tight, mineral and has a cool, light character with the merest hint of tannin. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2013 Coeur de Vendanges  (Beaujolais)

description: Attractive cherry flavors give a ripe, rounded feel that's balanced by the acidity and tannins. Black cherries burst easily from the glass, delivering a full aftertaste.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a rich style of rosé, rounded and fruity with good texture, wild strawberry flavors and very crisp acidity at the end. It's an attractive wine and one that's worth keeping until 2015.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2013 Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: While the wine has a crisp side, it's also full of red fruits and soft tannins. That makes for a wine that's fragrant, fruity, ready to drink and not likely to age much. Enjoy it now.
title: Manoir du Carra 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is rich, spicy and full of red cherry flavor. It also has a dark, firm structure from the granite-based soil. The acidity that cuts through the fruit lends balance. Age this for 2–3 years.
title: Château des Jacques 2011 Clos de Rochegrès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Made using fruit that was sourced from vines planted in 1939, this wine shows the great concentration low yields and old vines can give. It has Gamay's natural freshness, with firm, dry tannins, a spice note and a fragrant finish. It's drinkable now, but it will be better in two years.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2011 Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)

description: This light, fresh Chardonnay has lively pear and apple flavors. A crisp texture gives zing to the brightly fruity wine. Drink now.
title: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This wine is light, fruity and with only a slightly tannic character. Aromatic cherry flavors give freshness and bring out a jammy character. It's ready to drink.
title: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2014 Les Vignes de Thulon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine is tight, fresh with crisp red currant and red-cherry flavors. It is as bright as a button, fruity with layers of acidity that bring out a perfumed character at the end. The Colonge family has been growing grapes in Beaujolais since 1789.
title: Domaine André Colonge 2014  Beaujolais

description: Fresh and fruity, this is a ripe, cherry-flavored wine (hence the name Griottes, a type of cherry). It is light with a straight line of acidity that cuts through the attractive fruitiness. Drink immediately.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2014 Les Griottes Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: Banana aromas don't intrude too strongly into the fruity palate of this wine that has a crisp character. Tart red-berry fruits and and bright acidity give the wine a fresh, totally fruity appeal with only a hint of tannin. Drink now.
title: Domaine Pral 2014 Les Pays de Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

description: Structured and firm, this wine has more in the way of dry tannins than of fruit. It presents a fine skeleton without much flesh, leaving a wine that is tight and extracted. It needs plenty of time, so drink from late 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014  Chiroubles

description: This structured wine has a tight, tannic, dry character. It is slow to develop, leaving the black cherry fruits still masked by the forward dryness. Drink from 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine du Paradis  (Saint-Amour)

description: This wine is totally fresh, with crisp red currant and riper banana flavors—a bright wine that's all fruit and refreshing acidity. The family has been in the wine business since 1811 and today works with some 50 small-production growers.
title: Loron et Fils 2014 Beau!  (Beaujolais)

description: Bold and fruity, this is laden with bitter cherry and juicy plum flavors. The tannins are light and attractive, with juicy, refreshing acidity. Age this for a few more months.
title: Robert Perroud 2011 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: This has a firmly tannic structure and juicy fruit, suggesting its aging potential. It is rich and ripe, with black cherry and plum flavors that create a generous finish.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Domaine de la Source  (Chiroubles)

description: Showing a mineral-driven structure and firm tannins, this is a Beaujolais that needs to age. Rich and juicy, its perfumed red fruits currently cut through the dry tannins.
title: Château de Raousset 2011  Chiroubles

description: For a Morgon, this is relatively light, showing more fruit than structure, with freshness that's tempered by a firm edge and minerality. Keep for a year, or drink now.
title: Signé Vigneron 2011 Domaine de l'Oseraie  (Morgon)

description: Too alcoholic for its own good, the wine is full bodied and heavy. It has tannins, superripe black fruits while missing structure and acidity. It is developing fast and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: A fruity wine with soft tannins that is ready to drink. It has banana, red cherry and light spice flavors, finished off with attractive acidity.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: A rich wine, full of black fruits, ripe tannins and juicy acidity. It's powerful and structured, showing a mineral texture, bold acidity and ample fruitiness.
title: Signé Vigneron 2012 Domaine de la Croix Rouge  (Juliénas)

description: This tastes bone dry, with a caramel note that's followed by light, bright notes of red berry and apple. The finish is crisp and tight.
title: Château de Pizay 2011 Rosé d'Une Nuit Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: A classically fruity Beaujolais from the south of the region, this is packed with bitter cherry and ripe raspberry flavors. The tannins are soft—plentiful enough to lend structure. It is delicious, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2011 Les Griottes  (Beaujolais)

description: This has surprisingly structured fruits and firm tannins for a Nouveau, and it still maintains a juicy cherry flavor and ripe acidity. The finish has a tangy, textured character.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a concentrated, firm and tannic wine. It has a structured feel from Chiroubles, which are the highest vineyards in Beaujolais. With its black fruits, dark tannins and concentrated texture, it could certainly age for 2–3 years, although it is ready to drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine des Pontheux  (Chiroubles)

description: From an estate enveloping a magnificent medieval castle, this is a lightly structured cru wine with red cherry and berry flavors. It has a backdrop of tannins and acidity that give it structure. The wine is ripe and fruity at the end and ready to drink.
title: Château de la Terrière 2015  Brouilly

description: This is a romantic conjunction of names. The cru wine is silky and smooth, with integrated tannins and red-cherry fruit. It is bright and crisply textured, ready to drink from mid-2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine du Paradis  (Saint-Amour)

description: This cru wine comes from a 44-acre vineyard with 50-year-old vines supplied by one of Duboeuf's regular growers. It is structured and dense, perhaps too dense with its heavy dry tannins. The wine will need time. Drink from 2019.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

description: Full of crisp fruit, this cru wine is bright with red-berry flavors. It is light and with a cool character that comes from the high altitude of the vineyards. There is an edgy texture that keeps the wine together. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Chiroubles)

description: A floral wine, full of ripe black-cherry fruit and with a firm structure that sustains the wine. This cru wine is rich, still developing, still with enough tannins and acidity to allow it to age further. Drink this attractive wine from mid-2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

description: This three-acre parcel has produced a beautiful fruity wine. With red cherry and spice flavors, the wine is perfumed and juicy. Crisp acidity shoots through the attractive fruit to give a wine that is only lightly tannic and ready to drink.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2015 En Rémont Vignes de 1939  (Chénas)

description: Named after the steeply sloping vineyard, the wine is cool, crisp with tight cherry flavors. It is lined with acidity and some tannins. The wine will need another few months to soften out and become richer.
title: Robert Perroud 2015 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: The wine is still young with its crisp red fruits and tense tannins. It is a structured wine, firm with a dry core and still developing its fruitiness. It will need to age a while yet, so drink from 2018.
title: Yohan Lardy 2015 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This is one of several estates in this cru appellation where Georges Duboeuf makes and markets the wine. It is lightly wood aged to smooth out the ebullient fruits. Rich and with some firm tannins that will develop, it has concentration and a dense texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château de Juliénas  (Juliénas)

description: This cru estate is owned by the Duboeuf family. The wine has some wood aging that adds to the rich texture while not detracting from the ripe juicy red-cherry fruit. With its tannins, the wine could age, so drink from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

description: From the south-east facing Côte du Py, this is a powerfully structured wine. It is as full of tannins as of ripe red fruits. The wine with its dense character it likely to age well over several years. Drink from 2018.
designation: Domaine de Javernière Côte du Py
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de Javernière Côte du Py  (Morgon)

description: Owned by the Darroze family, the cru wine from this estate is produced by Georges Duboeuf. It is a dense wine with balancing rich black fruits. Its spicy cherry-fruit flavor and rich tannins give a wine that should age further. Drink from 2018.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine des Quatres Vents  (Fleurie)

description: Ripe perfumed black fruits dominate this cru wine. They float above the firm tannins and concentrated acidity to offer a wine that will become rich and generous as it develops. A touch of pepper and spice adds to the layers of fruit. Drink from 2018
title: Pardon et Fils 2015 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

description: A four-acre parcel of old vines is the source of this dense and rich wine. It has jammy red berry and cherry fruits that are lifted by the mineral texture and acidity. The wine is balanced although it does need to age. Drink from the end of 2017.
title: Terroirs et Talents 2015 Clos de la Brosse  (Saint-Amour)

description: This is a beautifully perfumed wine, ripe with black fruits and generous with its tannins and acidity. It comes from a one-acre parcel called Le Vivier which has 70-year-old vines. It is concentrated, dense and with aging potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Yohan Lardy 2015 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)

description: The wine is still young with its crisp red fruits and tense tannins. It is a structured wine, firm with a dry core and still developing its fruitiness. It will need to age a while yet, so drink from 2018.
title: Yohan Lardy 2015 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Aged in large wood barrels for seven months, the wine is ripe and structured. It also has fine fruitiness, rich tannins and soft acidity. The wine will be better from 2017.
title: Château Gaillard 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: With a vineyard planted in the traditional Beaujolais style of individual bushes rather than trained on wires, this is a light, soft and fruity wine. It has attractive tannins and fresh red fruits. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château des Vierres  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: There is an earthy character to this wine. It gives a dry edge to the black fruits and crisp acidity. The wine has the tannins typical of the appellation although it also has a light herbal touch that is less attractive. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2014  Morgon

description: This is a generous, ripe wine, full of red fruits and soft acidity. It's already enjoyable, but will benefit from aging until 2015 to bring out the refreshing fruitiness even more.
title: Château de Corcelles 2012  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Dominated by its dry tannins, this is a tight black currant and dark plum skin-flavored wine, surrounded by a firm core of tannins, a firm and dark-hued wine.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Clos des Garands  (Fleurie)

description: There is great structure here, with dusty tannins percolating through the rich wine. It has power, concentration and density, with cocoa and cherry flavors well integrated. Think about aging for 1–2 years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This rich wine features ripe, jammy red-plum and cherry fruits. It is dense, with its tannins and a touch of pepper coming from the high alcohol. The wine is a blend from five parcels. Ripe and with a juicy aftertaste, it will be best from 2018.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Vuril  (Brouilly)

description: This wine is structured and firm, its red fruits waiting behind the wood and tannin complexity. It shows plenty of potential through its good acidity and cherry fruitiness. Drink from late 2018.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Morgon)

description: The small Beaujolais cru of Chénas is next door to Moulin à Vent. As this wine shows, it has the same firm structure and ripe fruit. The wine from the cru's chateau is dense, smoky and has plenty of firm tannins. It is a wine to age, so drink from 2019.
title: Château de Chénas 2015  Chénas

description: With no wood aging, the fruit speaks in this wine. However, it does have tannins and a stalky, young character, along with generous black-cherry fruit and a touch of spice. The wine needs to age a few months more, so drink from 2018.
title: Florent Descombe 2015  Chénas

description: This is a perfumed wine that is soft, full of red cherry fruit and gentle tannins. It does have a dry core that gives the wine shape and there is plenty of juicy fruitiness at the end. The wine is made for the Hospices, a charity in Lyon.
designation: Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon
title: Collin-Bourisset 2014 Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Named after the medieval rulers of the village, this cru wine is firm and structured in the solid style of the appellation. It has rich black cherry and black-plum fruits that come with juicy acidity. At the same time, the tannins and the dry core promise considerable aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Trenel Fils 2015 Les Capitans  (Juliénas)

description: Owned by Beaune merchant Louis Jadot, this cru estate produces some impressive wines. While its alcohol is excessive for a Beaujolais, it wears its power well. The black plum fruit and tannins from wood aging that are still very present will soften over the next year to give a rich generous wine with a style that is Burgundian rather than traditional Beaujolais. Drink from 2018.
title: Château des Jacques 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

description: The northernmost of the Beaujolais cru villages can produce wines that are Burgundian in their structure. This wine fits that profile well with its dark tannins and rich concentration. Densely textured with both black-cherry fruit and a dry core, the wine is taking its time to develop. Drink from late 2017 or 2018.
title: Domaine des Chers 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Amour)

description: Richly structured this wine, from well-exposed vines (hence the land of light in the name) is fruity with black cherry and some firm tannins. It is going to develop into a serious, complex wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Chatelard 2015 Cuvée Terre de Lumière  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: From an small estate that also has vines in Chénas and Saint-Amour, this is a firmly tannic wine that also has attractive juicy red-berry fruits. The wine, still young, will repay aging allowing it to broaden out with rich fruit and a soft texture. Drink this cru from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de Roche Noire  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This Burgundian negociant take on Beaujolais is soft and ripe. Juicy red-berry fruits and supporting acidity receive a firm base of tannins. It is young, fruity and ready to drink from 2018.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Saint-Amour)

description: Very fresh, crisp raspberry flavors are layered with acidity. This shows the bright red fruit character of 2007—light, fragrant, maybe finishing with some leanness.
title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2007 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)

description: Soft and fruity, showing attractive ripe red cherry fruits along with hints of candy, light acidity and gentle tannins. It's a pleasing wine, easy and ready to drink, one of those Beaujolais that is best slightly chilled.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2007  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Tannins form a dark barrier to start this wine. It is still young, dense with chocolate as well as fruit flavors, showing the bitter, tough flavors that come from too much extraction. The fruit will hopefully come through and soften the tannins and bring out the richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Yohan Lardy 2014 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Firm, concentrated and dense, this is a solid wine with a good future. Rich black fruits, red cherries and expressive acidity are all coming together alongside the dry core of tannins. Age this fine wine and drink from 2017.
title: Lucien Lardy 2014 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

description: Henry Fessy's can-can dancer is with us again on this bottle of red cherry fruity wine. There is a texture of acidity, the fruit attractively integrated. Soft tannins complete this fresh, fruity wine.
title: Henry Fessy 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: A wine with some warm black cherry fruit as well as structured acidity. It has a dry texture to go with the fruit, making it a ripe but food friendly wine.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Automne Festif  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: Organically grown grapes went into this perfumed wine. It is fruity, crisp with bright cherry flavors and lifted with acidity. The wine is still developing, still bringing its tannins to the fore. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2014 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

description: The vines around Chiroubles are some of the highest in Beaujolais. That gives wines with a structure, although here, this structure has been lost in the heavy fruit. It is very full, rich and with black-cherry flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Chiroubles)

description: The wine has weight and richness while also showing considerable acidity and dry tannic structure. It's firm, the fruitiness showing slowly through the mineral texture. It will be better in 2015.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Eté Intense  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: The wine is round, soft and ripe with attractive lightweight tannins. Plum fruit flavors are right up front. It's rich while remaining easy and drinkable now.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Brouilly

description: The wine is so young, it almost has a prickle on the tongue. It is very fresh and still rather tight with acidity and crisp berry fruits. Wait until 2015 for this fruity wine to settle down and open up.
title: Domaine des Marrans 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The year's bottle aging has rounded this wine out and has softened the fresh red fruits into a more generous, full-bodied texture. The acidity, always present shows as a counterpoint to the ripe fruits. Drink now.
title: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2012  Beaujolais

description: Bold and fruity, this is packed with cherries as well as acidity. A plum skin texture gives structure to this still closed-up wine. Wait until 2015.
title: Domaine Lagneau 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Light and only gently structured, this is a cru wine that is more about juicy red fruits. It has attractive acidity and a touch of spice. It is likely to be ready to drink in the next few months, certainly by mid-2017.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Léon  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This is a ripe, soft and rich cru wine. With its attractive cherries and gentle tannic structure, it is fruity and easy. The acidity that comes through at the end gives the wine a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 Pisse Vieille  (Brouilly)

description: This grand estate was once a hunting ground for an even grander nearby chateau. The cru wine that's now produced here is crisp and fruity, streaked through with acidity and red currants. It has a touch of tannin as well as minerality. Drink from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château de Nervers  (Brouilly)

description: This is a family-owned estate whose wines is made by Georges Duboeuf. It is structured and firmly concentrated, more tannin than fruit. That gives the wine a lean character that seems to miss out on fleshy and fruit. Give it a little time and drink from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Clos des Quatres Vents  (Fleurie)

description: The Chermette family has produced a rich generous cru wine. It is structured and dense with some firm tannins from maturing in wood. It also has a generous black plum and cherry fruits that are developing well. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2015 Les Garants  (Fleurie)

description: Produced from old vines in the Côte du Py on the slopes of an extinct volcano, this cru wine is structured with generous black fruits and a series of ripe tannins and balanced acidity. It has the structure and density to age while also having a light touch of black cherry fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Stéphane Aviron 2015 Côte du Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: Although he is based in the Terres Dorées (golden earth) region of southern Beaujolais, this producer has an enviable palate of vineyards in the crus to the north. This wine comes from one. It has structure, density and a a solid core of both tannins and rich fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Jean-Paul Brun 2015 Terres Dorées Grille-Midi  (Fleurie)

description: Rounded, and rich, this is touched with spicy wood and has plenty of black berry fruits. A solid structure, some fruit tannin and plenty of red-plum-skin edge finishes ripe.
title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2006 Cuvée Prestige  (Juliénas)

description: Made from old vines and aged in wood, this is a rich, dense, now mature wine. The bright red fruit is softened by the wood, rounded out, then balanced with tannins.
title: Domaine Cheysson 2005 Cuvée Prestige  (Chiroubles)

description: Good structured fruit, with ripe sweet cherry flavors, appears alongside hints of raspberries. Fresh, but with some weight and solidity.
title: Château du Châtelard 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine, solid and dense, is full of firm tannins as well as red cherry fruits. It's also fruity, with a great juicy character that permeates right through the wine. For drinking now, but better kept for 2–3 years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine de Lavernée  (Chiroubles)

description: This serious, solid wine has all the structure of Morgon with its firm, mineral texture. Rich and full-bodied, it's packed with dark plum and blackberry fruits as well as firm, ageworthy tannins. Drink from 2015.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Hiver Gourmand  (Morgon)

description: Puy means a hill, and the steep slopes of the Côte du Puy offer great exposure for the vines. The result is a densely structured, very muscular wine that shows richness as well as dark tannins. The aftertaste is sweet, streaked with acidity.
title: Domaine Jean Foillard 2006 Côte du Puy  (Morgon)

description: There's an explosion of rich, intense fruit here: dried prunes, black plums and even some licorice. The wine is attractively edged with wood, giving a fine, ripe finish.
title: Domaine Chignard 2006 Cuvée Spéciale  (Fleurie)

description: Aged in wood, this cuvée is powerful, ripe and intense. The jellied red fruits are all sweet and rich, touched by acidity but mainly with good depth of flavor and structure. It would even be worth aging this for another year.
title: Château du Châtelard 2006 Cuvée Tradition  (Fleurie)

description: Gamay often becomes more like Pinot Noir as it ages. That's true of this wine, which displays strawberry and spice flavors, as well as an element of minerality. The aftertaste has ripe blackberry jelly.
title: Domaine Chignard 2005 Cuvée Spéciale  (Fleurie)

description: A very structured wine with tannins and dense fruit. Very Pinot Noir-like in its richness, smoothness and plum flavors. Deliciously rich and velvety smooth.
title: Jean-Paul Thevenet 2006  Morgon

description: An attractively fruity wine, this is rich in cherry and light spice flavors and is laden with acidity. It has a dry set of tannins, but it is so densely juicy that it is ready to drink now.
title: Clos de Haute-Combe 2011  Juliénas

description: Powerful and concentrated, this has a dark red-plum flavor and solid tannins. It is dense, and it shows the structure of the vintage. This is worth aging, and it certainly needs food to show at its best.
title: Domaine des Nugues 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Firm tannins set this wine on a path to aging. At the same time, it has a fine layer of intense fruitiness, and it is crisp and packed with blackberry fruit. It has the typical minerality and structure of Juliénas, so give it 2–3 years.
title: Pardon et Fils 2011 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

description: This is a structured wine, with solid tannins as well as bright red fruits that are developing well. The structure and dry core will allow this single-vineyard wine to age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Les Moriers  (Fleurie)

description: This is a serious, tannic wine that has a mineral edge to go with the tight fruit. It is, in fact, ageworthy—for a year or two, with the dry character needs to soften. At the end, the sweet Gamay fruits triumph.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Séléction  (Saint-Amour)

description: Still young, this wine has considerable acidity that is surprising. Its cherry fruits are fresh with soft tannins and a juicy aftertaste. It needs another six months to calm down. Drink from summer 2016.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Les Crêtes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: In keeping with the good quality of 2015's Beaujolais Nouveau, this is a ripe red fruit and black cherry flavored wine. It has really fresh, juicy acidity and the softest tannins. It's a bright, fruity wine that is just waiting to drink.
title: Domaine de la Madone 2015 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This solid and dense wine has firm tannins as well as juicy fruitiness. It is dark, rich and full of black fruits that are cut with intense acidity. It needs to age further, so drink from 2015.
title: Château de Bellevue 2011 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: Simple juicy fruit, just touched by tannins, but more driven by ripe plum juice and the brightest, delicious acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This soft wine is fruity, spicy and full of juicy red fruits. It offers plenty of acidity as well as a layer of tannins. An easy, open wine, it is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Bel-Air  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Dominated by red fruits, this wine also has the structure of 2010. It is firm and concentrated while always fruity and accessible. It could be kept for a few months, but really is ready to drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2010 Château de Saint-Lager  (Brouilly)

description: Showing definite maturity, this remains a solid, chunky wine. It has richness as well as a light structure of acidity and raspberries. It is very ready to drink now.
title: Loron et Fils 2005 Réserve Caveau Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This is a dense and rich wine, showing the power of a Morgon and the ripeness of the vintage. It is full bodied, dense and firmly tannic, with red plum and sweet cherry flavors. Keep this fine wine for another 2–3 years.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2009 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Cuvée d'Exception  (Morgon)

description: This big, burly effort is structured and solidly textured. It has weight accompanying the blackberry flavor, with a firm character that demands aging over at least 18 months. The finish is still firm and concentrated.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

description: A solid and chunky wine, this balances a rich structure with ripe, rounded fruit. Acidity cuts through the complex texture to give a juicy, fragrant feel. It's worth aging another year.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Morgon)

description: Ripe red fruits are aided by a core of dark tannin to give this wine good intensity. There is acidity, followed by bubbling fruit, topped with berries and spice. Worth keeping until next year.
title: Domaine du Moulin Berger 2007 Vayolette  (Juliénas)

description: With nearly 200 acres of vines, this is one of the largest Beaujolais estates. This Brouilly is ripe, raspberry-flavored, with fine sweet fruits and a tight core of tannin. The essential acidity is well balanced.
title: Mommessin 2006 Château de Pierreux  (Brouilly)

description: For a simple Beaujolais, this is an intensely rich wine with toast spice coming through the black cherry fruit. The tannins give a ripe structure. All the time, the wine remains true to its fruity origins.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2010 Cuvée de la Platière  (Beaujolais)

description: One of an increasing number of Chardonnays from Beaujolais—there should be more—this is soft and fruity. A touch of minerality runs through the rounded, ripe texture. Drink this refreshing wine now.
title: Château de Pizay 2016  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This Fleurie in the small production Prestige range shows firm tannins and structured fruit. It has a dry character, the fruitiness still developing as it ages. Acidity, a dark core and black cherry fruits promise aging for 2–3 years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Prestige  (Fleurie)

description: A soft and fruity wine, this is ripe with dark cherry and spice flavors. A hint of bananas from the fermentation spoils the rest of the ripe fruitiness of this ready-to-drink wine.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: This wine, made from organically grown grapes, is ripe, full of red-cherry fruits and soft tannins. It is an immediately attractive wine, packed with fruitiness and ready to drink. The village of Leynes is on the border between Beaujolais and Macon.
title: Château de Lavernette 2014 Cuvée Jadis Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

description: Simple but with depth, this wine has structure and some good tannins, along with the bright cherry fruit flavors and balanced acidity. It's a wine to drink now, full of flavor and ripe fruits.
title: Domaine de la Prébende 2011  Beaujolais

description: Full-bodied wine that is soft, washing easily over the palate. The downside is that it lacks definition, the tannic structure lost in the velvet texture. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château de la Perrière  (Brouilly)

description: This ripe, generous wine is full of the bold red fruits of this fine vintage. It also has structure, spicy wood flavors and a rich, full character. With its juicy acidity in the background and its impressive density, the wine is going to age a little longer. It will be best from late 2018.
title: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2015  Fleurie

description: While there is some unfortunate banana flavor, the rest of this wine is attractive. It has juicy black berry flavors, an edge of citrus and final lively acidity.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de Grand Croix  (Brouilly)

description: Simple but with depth, this wine has structure and some good tannins, along with the bright cherry fruit flavors and balanced acidity. It's a wine to drink now, full of flavor and ripe fruits.
title: Domaine de la Prébende 2011  Beaujolais

description: A rounded wine, this has an attractive red-jelly flavor and light acidity. It is full and rich, with fine acids on the finish. Keep for six months.
title: Trenel Fils 2011  Côte de Brouilly

description: Attractive and finely balanced, this has red cherry and strawberry flavors, which come wrapped in soft tannins and crisp acidity.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2011 Les Griottes Rosé Gamay (Beaujolais)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a generous, ripe wine that's full of juicy red-cherry fruits and gentle tannins. It has some richness, giving a sweet character to this open, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

description: This is a festive wine, with soft, ripe fruit and acidity, plus a red berry flavor.
title: Henry Fessy 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a wine with some tannic structure adding richness and shape to its red fruit character. Ripe cherries and red currants dominate, laced with acidity. It's ready to drink, but could improve over another year.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A wine with fresh, bright, red cherry and black currant fruits along with a tight tannic edge that speaks of the granite soil. It's likely to age over the next year.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Domaine du Riaz  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: Rather dilute wine, it does have some fresh cherry flavors with very soft tannins and a clean line of acidity. For the vintage, it could have done wth more concentration.
title: Jaffelin 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Organically grown grapes have yielded a firm, dense wine that brings out the power of Morgon. It has dark plum skins and cherry fruit, layered with firmly structured tannins. It's an impressive wine for aging 2–3 years.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2010  Morgon

description: The Côte du Py, one of the best cru vineyard sites in Beaujolais, is on the slope of a 3,000-foot extinct volcano. It produces structured wines that can age well. Stéphane Aviron brought out the quality of Py with a wine that is powerful, ripe and dense with considerable tannic structure. It will certainly need to age, so drink from 2019.
title: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Côte du Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: Be grateful that Stéphane Aviron is an old-vine hunter. Serious tannins and concentration from 100-year-old vines give this wine its depth and richness. It has a great potential to age with black fruits, a mineral texture and acidity. This is an impressive cru wine, full of both fruit and density. Drink from 2019.
title: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: A firm and structured cru wine from 100-year-old vines that has layers of firm fruits and tannins. It is a wine that is likely to mature well, with its wood aging and dry core. A blend from four parcels, it is concentrated and with a rich black-cherry character. Drink this exceptional wine, from old-vine hunter Stéphane Aviron, starting in 2020.
title: Stéphane Aviron 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

description: This rich, full wine delivers great balance between acidity, fruit and structure. It's ripe, with delicious cherry fruits and soft tannins. It could well age through 2015, but is delicious now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2012 Fleurs  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine is rich, with red fruits and balanced acidity. Soft and full-bodied, it delivers spice and red plum fruits at the end, with a juicy aftertaste.
title: Pardon et Fils 2012  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The wine is warm and round, full of ripe berry fruits and soft tannins. It's ready to drink now with its full structure, balanced acidity and juicy aftertaste.
title: Les Vins Aujoux 2013 Belle Grâce  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine is still young, showing more of its red fruits than the structure that will develop. The crisp, red cherry flavor shows the freshness and acidity of the vintage. It will be better in a year, so drink from late 2015.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2013  Fleurie

description: This Brouilly is light and smooth in character. The wine has hints of tannins under the bright cherry fruits, fresh acidity and open texture. It's not a wine for aging.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Château du Prieuré  (Brouilly)

description: A finely structured wine, very firm, with a dark edge of tannins over ripe black fruit. The wine is concentrated and dense, still developing and showing great final juicy character.
title: Domaine Pral 2008 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: A wine with some warm black cherry fruit as well as structured acidity. It has a dry texture to go with the fruit, making it a ripe but food friendly wine.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Automne Festif  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: With relatively high altitude vineyards, Chiroubles can produce wines like this, with an austere backbone and high acidity. Together they make for a tight wine with red berries and a dry texture. Age for six months.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Eté Fleuri  (Chiroubles)

description: Soft and richly fruity, this has all the right red cherry and banana flavors that are immediately attractive. A delicious, juicy wine. Screwcap.
title: Mommessin 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Produced from vines up to 80 years old, this is a powerful, wood-aged wine. Tannins are mixed with toast, spice and dark plum flavors. Acidity gives freshness and finishes the wine with very fine fruits as well as structure. Age this impressive wine and drink from 2018.
title: Richard Rottiers 2014  Moulin-à-Vent

description: This has a firmly tannic structure and juicy fruit, suggesting its aging potential. It is rich and ripe, with black cherry and plum flavors that create a generous finish.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Domaine de la Source  (Chiroubles)

description: Bold and fruity, this is laden with bitter cherry and juicy plum flavors. The tannins are light and attractive, with juicy, refreshing acidity. Age this for a few more months.
title: Robert Perroud 2011 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: Light and fruity, this is full of refreshing red berry fruits, making this a clean, forward apéritif. It has fragrant acidity on the finish.
title: Domaine des Nugues 2011 Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This is a classic, bold, fruity Nouveau, with firm tannins that add weight to the palate. Pair this with food.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Produced from old vines on the Chatelard estate, this wine is smooth, ripe and full of vibrant red fruits. There is a good balance between acidity and rich fruit with just a light core of tannins in the background. Drink now.
title: Château du Châtelard 2015 Cuvée les Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Based in Fleurie, this producer has made a wine rich in fruit and tannins. It has a smoky spicy character as well as intense red fruits. It is warm, concentrated and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Berrod 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The wine is built with a tannic structure that gives density. Red fruits vie with the dry tannins and acidity to produce a firm wine that could still age another few months. Drink starting from 2017.
title: Mommessin 2013 Domaine de la Presle  (Fleurie)

description: Produced from a small parcel of old vines, this is a crisp and fresh wine. With red-cherry fruit and acidity, it is a bright wine, up-front with its fruitiness and lively aftertaste.
title: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 Terre Noire Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: With crisp black berry fruits, this is pure juice in a glass. It has fresh acidity, a light layer of tannin and a sweet underlay to the attractive fruitiness.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Juliénas)

description: Tight, structured wine, with intense acidity as well as red berry fruits. It feels lean and sinewy, needing a few more months to settle and round out. Keep a year.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2010 Les Ravinets  (Juliénas)

description: With some firm tannins and considerable red fruit juiciness, this is a wine that combines a good fruity character with a solid structure. The balancing side is the acidity and very fresh finish.
title: Domaine de Billards 2009  Saint-Amour

description: Smooth and rich wine with fresh blackberry fruits and a hint of raisins. The wine relishes both its acidity and its ripe fruit character, the tannins giving an attractive final support.
title: Gaël Martin 2009 En Pressins  (Saint-Amour)

description: This is a firmly structured wine with a distinct tannic character to go with austere, mineral fruits. The wine is on the sour side, making it hard to love, although some juiciness does show through at the end.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2011 Domaine des Nazins  (Brouilly)

description: The wine is soft and fruity. Red berry and cherry flavors have a hint of banana as well as the layers of crisp acidity. Drink this fresh wine now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Brouilly)

description: A blend from different parts of the Fleurie appellation, this wine is elegant and floral. Crisp red fruits are sustained by acidity and by a juicy character. As often with this appellation, it is a wine to age and will be better from 2018.
title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 La Chanaise  (Morgon)

description: This beautifully perfumed wine is ripe, structured and well on the way to being delicious. Tannins and spice flavors have melded into rich black-cherry fruits cut with acidity. The wine could age for another few months, so drink from 2018.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2014 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Morgon)

description: This wine is soft and fruity, with just an edge of dryness at the center. It is more about red berry and cherry brightness, with an attractive twist of pepper. Drink now.
title: Domaine Dupré 2014 Terre Noire Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: Light in color, this wine seems already mature. It has a leathery character, the fruit subdued to the structure. It's attractive to drink as a mature wine that is ready now.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2013 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

description: An organic, low-sulphur wine, this is all about soft fruitiness. Red fruits shine along with the texture that has just an edge of dryness. Acidity penetrates right through this fresh, light wine. A member of Terroirs Originels, Victor Sornin is a ninth-generation winemaker.
title: Domaine Victor Sornin 2014 Nature  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Aromas of bananas follow through to the palate of this wine, spoiling the structured black plums and tannins. The wine is fresh and juicy, with some dry structure at the background. Drink from 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This wine has structure and freshness although the fruit is on the lean side, offering black cherries and swathes of crisp acidity. The aftertaste is juicy, fresh and mineral.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine dit Baron  (Brouilly)

description: While there is a good structure here, this wine is spoiled by banana flavors that dominate the otherwise attractive red berry fruits. Acidity and a dry tannic core suggest some aging, so maybe the wine will round out.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

description: Light and freshly crisp, this has a good mix of red fruits and tangy acidity. It's so light both in color and flavor, bright at the end and delicious.
title: Terroirs et Talents 2014 Domaine Romy Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This wine is fruity although it also has weight and a rich strand of spice and red plum-skin tannins. This 100% Gamay could age at least until early 2016, although one can just drink it now.
title: Louis Jadot 2014  Beaujolais

description: Very perfumed in character, the wine has a bright red cherry flavor, with some weight and structure. There are good tannins and a warm, soft finish. The wine could age for another year.
designation: Château la Tour de Bief Claude de la Tour
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010 Château la Tour de Bief Claude de la Tour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This wine is so pale in color, with bright fruitiness and a light pepper and spice touch. The wine is soft and tangy, with plenty of aromatic acidity at the end.
title: Lucien Lardy 2014 Opaline Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This firm wine has smoky tannins and red-currant acidity. It is still young, its structure still dry and solid. Wait until the end of 2016 before drinking.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

description: This fresh and crisp raspberry-flavored wine is refreshing. It is all fruit with just a touch of tangy lemon zest to give extra freshness. The largest single plot of vines in Beaujolais and Burgundy, 244 acres in Bruilly cru, the estate has been in the same family since 1667 and is a historical monument.
title: Château de la Chaize 2014 Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This ripe and structured wine has a good balance between rich tannins and full, jammy red-berry fruits. It's attractive, with layers of fruit cut with acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Thulon 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is a light, dancing wine, crisp and full of fruit. It has a fragrant, refreshing red currant and raspberry flavor with tight, lively acidity. Drink this crisp, fruity wine now.
title: Domaine de Thulon 2014 Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Fresh apples and ripe pears give this wine its fruity character. The acidity behind this fruit is already in balance. It's a young Chardonnay that needs a while to fill out. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine des Nugues 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This is a textured wine from a six-acre vineyard. It has fine tannins as well as red-plum skin and red-berry fruits. It is balanced and fruity although the texture does give it a tangy edge that should soften out from 2017.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2015 Quatre Saisons  (Beaujolais)

description: The wine is structured and with a tannic edge to shape up the red fruits. It has the concentration of old vines that is good. Rich and full in the mouth, this is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Marrans 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: Densely planted 20-year-old vines provide the fruit for this wine. With its layer of tannins over the red fruits and acidity, it is fruity while having structure. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2015 Le Ronsay  (Beaujolais)

description: Ripe, soft and fruity, this is a black-cherry-flavored wine. It has a good balance between the fruit and the crisp acidity, giving a wine that is both rich and bursting with fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Florent Descombe 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: From vines around the medieval castle, this wine has brilliant cherry flavors that give fruitiness and balancing acidity. There is a refreshing juicy character that is sustained by the subtle touch of tannin. Drink the wine now.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Château de Chanzé  (Beaujolais)

description: A smooth and soft wine, this offers gentle red-cherry flavors. The acidity and edge of firm tannins give this attractive wine its shape. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016  Brouilly

description: This is Yohan Lardy's top wine, produced from vines planted in 1903. Dark and dense although shot with acidity, the wine is firm and concentrated. It layers a floral character with minerality and black fruits. The wine needs to age further, so drink from 2018.
title: Yohan Lardy 2014 Vieilles Vignes de 1903  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: The wine is structured and with intense acidity and a tight texture. A mineral character goes through the wine, contrasting with the red fruit. It is a serious wine that will repay aging, so drink from 2018. This organic vineyard is switching to biodynamic.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2014 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: The wine has a bitter edge with a burnt character that clashes with the red fruit and banana flavors. Maybe better in a few months, but by then, of course, it will have been drunk.
title: Albert Bichot 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This soft and rounded wine offers gentle acidity and warm cherry flavors. It's full, touched by smoke and a red plum skin texture. Give this attractive wine until 2015 for its full potential to show.
title: Château de Chatelard 2013 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Bright and juicy, this fruity wine has plenty of cherry acidity and bright acidity. It's attractive to drink now with its broad texture and crisp aftertaste.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Château de Vierres  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a rich wine, with a texture that's comfortably cushioned by ripe cherry and plum flavors. It's a wine to savor now, full and fruity.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine Pignard  (Beaujolais)

description: Ample fruitiness is accompanied by an attractive tannin and mineral texture and well-integrated acidity. It's a rounded wine that is ready to drink, with red cherry fruits that are full and ripe.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Beaujolais

description: Generous ripe fruit is found on a wine packed with cherry and raspberry flavors. Hints of banana appear along with the vintage's signature tannic structure. Keep for 6–9 months.
title: Pierre Dupond 2010 Domaine de Boischampt  (Juliénas)

description: This is a soft, ample wine, with an attractive tang of black cherry and ripe acidity. The wine has just the right juicy fruitiness.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2010 Domaine Rolland  (Brouilly)

description: Very ripe, as befits 2009, this is still a young wine. It is packed with fruit, some hints of wood, delicious fresh red berries and acidity that balances the firmly tannic core. Keep the wine a year at least for the full richness to develop.
title: Domaine le Cotoyon 2009 Les Mouilles  (Juliénas)

description: This is a solid, structured wine that is still young. Firm tannins go with the berry fruits and acidity. Today, it's still tight and closed up, so it needs time to open out. Wait until 2016.
title: Anita et André Kuhnel 2013 Coteau de Malval  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: While the wine is fresh, it also has a bitter, cheesy character that is more funky than fruity. The acidity is very present, giving a crisp edge. Drink now.
title: Domaine Pral 2014 Les Pays de Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: With light tannins and herbal fruit flavors, this is a crisp, tight wine. Red-berry flavors show through along with a greener character and tannins that are not quite ripe. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014  Beaujolais

description: This earthy Chardonnay from a limestone plot has more to do with texture and tight acidity than fruit. It presents a sharp, too-crisp edge.
title: Gérard Charvet 2014 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a young wine, full of fruit and still packed with dry tannins. Its future is good, with layers of juicy ripe black cherry flavors under the tannins that promise a ripe and full-bodied wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Château de Javernand  (Chiroubles)

description: Only the juice at the heart of the pressing is used to make this attractive and ripely fruity wine. It has a soft, full texture with juicy acidity and generous tannins. The wine is dense, packed with red plum and berry flavors and finished with just the right, fresh acidity. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Coeur de Presse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine is all about red berries and fresh cherries. Some tannins and an earthy edge to the palate add complexity. Drink this fruity, juicy wine now.
title: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2012 Couvent des Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Named after the village of Emeringes where the vineyard plots are situated, this wine offers both tannins and the freshest fruit. A red plum-skin texture gives a tight edge that also adds great freshness. The wine will develop over the next few months; drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2014 Emeringes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This deliciously warm and ripe wine has swathes of red fruit that are full of energy and richness. It offers a touch of perfumed spice and good acidity. Drink now, although the wine will be better from early 2016.
title: Domaine de la Madone 2014 Tradition  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This ripe wine has rich black fruits, a smoky character and a rounded, full-bodied texture. The old vines bring concentration, while the acidity gives freshness and drinkability now.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2014 Cuvée Traditionelle Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: This wine has dry tannins and some concentration as well as the bright, cherry-fresh Beaujolais fruit. That gives it a serious side with structure and potential. The 100% Gamay vineyard is on slopes in the heart of Beaujolais Villages. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Dubost 2014 Cuvée Tracot  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a soft wine with a great depth of red fruits and fresh acidity. The tannins are light, just a hint of dry behind the fragrant, bright fruitiness. The wine, made from old vines, is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Dupré 2014 Haute Ronze Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

description: From the least-known of the Beaujolais cru villages, this wine is soft and supple in character with ripe, firm tannins to support the fruitiness. Red berries and acidity give the wine its bright aspect while still retaining a good sense of structure. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2016.
title: Château de Pizay 2014  Régnié

description: Bright and fresh, this is a totally fruity wine with a more serious edge at the end. Red cherries push through the crisp acidity that offers a zingy texture. The touch of minerality in the 40-year-old vines from the Chapoly vineyard granite soil gives an austere, structured aftertaste.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Packed with black-cherry flavors, this is a structured wine. Its acidity chimes well with the mineral texture and tangy black-currant and berry flavors. The wine is fruity while still firm and likely to age. Drink from mid-2016.
title: Domaine Cordier 2014 Les Grandes Plantes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Owned by Beaune négociant Louis Jadot, this wine is big, bold and fruity, with black cherry flavor and acidity. It shows the structure and the potential of wood-aged Gamay.
title: Château des Jacques 2011  Moulin-à-Vent

description: Concentrated fruits dominate this ripe, juicy wine. Firm tannins lend structural support to this generous, textured selection. Age it for another year.
title: Robert Perroud 2010 La Fournaise du Pérou  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: Using fruit sourced from 94-year-old vines, this is a powerful and concentrated wine. It has a serious, complex mix of fruit and tannin, with notes of leather and spice that lend power and density. Age this for at least another year.
title: Domaine Dupré 2011 Vignes de 1918  (Régnié)

description: The sense of structure that is so evident in 2010 wines is particularly apparent in this perfumed, rich and firmly tannic selection. It shows the hard edges of granite soil, plus juicy red fruit. Concentrated and complex, it needs several years to mature.
title: Trenel Fils 2010 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

description: This is a firm and stony wine, with dry tannins that give structure to the intense acidity and the red cherry flavor. It's dense and concentrated, with a solid feel that demands several years of aging.
title: Richard Rottiers 2011  Moulin-à-Vent

description: A smooth, fruity wine, with fine red-cherry flavors and very soft tannins. It is spoiled by a banana flavor that intrudes into the fresh fruit.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine du Buyats  (Régnié)

description: The banana aromas are off-putting in this light, juicy wine. Although there are tannins, they are not enough to make sense of the simple, jammy fruit.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 La Trinquée  (Juliénas)

description: There are raspberry flavors, certainly, but raspberry with attitude, as this wine, with its firm tannins and open fruit, attests. The acidity and the dry edge point this wine firmly toward food.
title: Château de la Terrière 2006  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is a fresh and cool wine from the highest of the Beaujolais cru villages. Produced by Céline and Nicolas Hirsch, originally from Alsace, the wine is bright with red cherries and currants. It has some tannins that firm up the structure, giving it shape and the possibility of aging. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Domaine Hirsch 2014  Chénas

description: This is a perfumed wine that is soft, full of red cherry fruit and gentle tannins. It does have a dry core that gives the wine shape and there is plenty of juicy fruitiness at the end. The wine is made for the Hospices, a charity in Lyon.
designation: Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon
title: Collin-Bourisset 2014 Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Crisp, red hedgerow fruits and wild strawberries add to the acidity in this wine. There is an edge of greenness, but there is also some weight. Certainly not a powerful wine.
title: Terroirs et Talents 2007 Domaine de Boischampt  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is an impressively rich wine for a simple Beaujolais. It has plenty of fruit, while it also has a good depth with ripe red-berry fruits and some well-integrated tannins.
title: Collin-Bourisset 2015  Beaujolais

description: A structured and concentrated wine that is packed with tannins. It does have some black fruit under this dry structure although the wine misses out on richness. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
designation: Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Le Regard de l'Ange
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2013 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup Le Regard de l'Ange  (Morgon)

description: There are some fine, dry tannins in this wine along the dark cherry fruit and acidity. It comes from a single vineyard part of the 61-acre estate of Jean-Paul Dubost. There is a ripe feeling here; drink this balanced wine now.
title: Domaine Dubost 2015 Climat le Tracot  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a wine that has tannins as well as crisp red-currant fruit. It is lightly textured with a bright shot of acidity. The aftertaste is fresh and lively.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2015 Special Selection  (Beaujolais)

description: This banana-flavored wine is soft and gently fruity. It has crisp acidity as well as a light tangy texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Thulon 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Big, bold and tannic, this is powerful Gamay from La Tour du Bief vineyard in Juliénas. It has weight, and a concentrated texture that bodes well for the wine's future. Along with this structure are the fragrant black and red currant fruits, already delicious to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Clef du Bief  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Finely structured, this is a fruity wine with bright cherry fruit and acidity. It has a drier edge that gives it texture and shape. The fresher aftertaste gives the wine a fruity lift. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 La Rose Pourpre Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: A light and fruity wine with a slight tincture of tannin and acidity. Red-cherry and banana flavors dominate this readily drinkable wine.
title: Barton & Guestier 2015 Les Violettes  (Beaujolais)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine is structured and still firm, with ripe berry fruits buried in the structure. As it matures, this rich wine will open out generously. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Nature  (Morgon)

description: Produced from vines that are up to 40 years old, this is a firmly structured wine. Concentration and dry tannins come from some firm extraction. The fruit though is ripe and juicy, showing red-berry flavors along with spice from the wood aging. Drink the wine from 2019.
title: Château de Chénas 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

description: This ripe, fruity and perfumed wine is delicious. Juicy red and black fruits ooze from every part of its smoky structure. It comes from vines on a small plateau called Pisse-Vieille in Brouilly. The wine is ready to drink for its fruity pleasure.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Pisse-Vieille  (Brouilly)

description: This is a tight wine, firm with tannins and with a bitter edge. Jammy cherry fruits lie behind this structure, along with acidity. The wine will soften and be ready to drink from 2018.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a Mâcon region-wide blend, simple and fruity with an attractively crisp texture. It has a citrus character, slightly salty as well as tangy with orange zest. Drink now.
title: Florent Descombe 2014  Moulin-à-Vent

description: This light and fruity wine, produced by a Burgundy negotiant, is full of bitter cherry crispness. It is ready to drink, offering acidity and a tight, bright aftertaste.
title: Maison Jean-Baptiste Béjot 2014 La Perlière  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: With its hint of acidity along with the textured fruit, this is a fruity wine that is balanced between richness and crispness. It has a light tannic structure that gives the wine its shape and ability to age for a few more months before drinking. Drink from mid-2017.
title: Trenel Fils 2015  Côte de Brouilly

description: Based in the village of Beaujeu, this producer has made a dense wine that needs time for the fruits to develop. It is juicy with acidity that is beginning to show through the tannins. Give this cru wine time and drink starting from 2018.
title: Pardon et Fils 2015 Domaine Pardon Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

description: Beaujolais Blanc is effectively Burgundy-type Chardonnay but from the southern neighbor Beaujolais region. This wine, with its ripe and creamy texture, has the same rich character as a Mâcon wine. It is smooth and soft from a warm vintage for white wines. Drink this wine now.
title: Château de Lavernette 2015 Les Vignes de la Roche  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: The ripe fruit of this vintage is right up front in this strawberry and spice-flavored wine. With a texture that adds a touch of tannin to the fruitiness, it is smooth and round. Drink this aromatic wine from 2018.
title: Château des Loges 2015 Sélection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: There are certainly plenty of tannins here, but they are balanced by rich fruit, strawberry juice flavors and freshness. Structured ripeness is the hallmark here.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2010 Domaine Rolland  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: Full-on banana aromas create a wine that tastes like an elderly nouveau. It does have some fruit and red cherries, but with a bitter edge, it really should have been drunk by now.
title: Vignoble Charmet 2011 Masfraise  (Beaujolais)

description: A big, ripe wine, with firm tannins, powerful with black plum flavors. It is aged in large barrels, adding an extra complexity, structured with some dryness in the aftertaste.
title: Domaine Cheysson 2005 La Secrète  (Chiroubles)

description: A rich, rounded wine, benefiting from concentrated fruit. There are solid tannns, dark bitter cherry fruits, licorice and fine ripeness. The aftertaste is ripe and sweet.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2006 Les Trois Roches  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: From a 15-acre vineyard owned by Georges Duboeuf. It is a big, bold, ripe wine backed by light wood flavors, and juicy red plum fruits. It is vivid, colorful and solid.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2006 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

description: From a seven-acre parcel on the estate and produced from 35-year-old vines, this is a tannin-dominated wine. It is firm, with concentration that is just beginning to show the rich black-cherry fruits. Still developing, it needs to age, Drink from 2018.
title: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2011 Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This wine is soft and rounded, ready to drink with its rich black-fruit character and fully integrated tannins. It holds a blend from five different parcels on the estate, ripe in berry fruits and fragrant with the wood aging. Acidity gives a lift at the end.
title: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2011  Moulin-à-Vent

description: Based in Fleurie in northern Beaujolais, this Marrans Gamay is firm and with good tannins, delivering both fruit and structure. With a dark layer of smokiness as well as black-cherry fruit flavors, it is concentrated and worth aging a few months. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine des Marrans 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Based in the village of Lancié in the heart of the Beaujolais crus, this producer has made a ripe wine that is full of black-cherry fruits and balanced tannins. It is concentrated and ripe, perfumed with a fresh, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine André Collonge 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Bright red fruits in this attractive cherry and banana flavored wine. It has a soft tannic edge, laced with acidity and finishing spice.
title: Paul Durdilly 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Excellent color on this firmly fruity wine. It has an attractive edge of tannins giving it good structure while showing all of the fresh nouveau fruit.
title: Antonin Rodet 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: With its bright cherry fruits, this is a warm and ripe wine. It has soft tannins and strawberry acidity. Drink now for red fruit pleasure.
title: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2010  Beaujolais

description: With its wood aging and rich, concentrated black cherry fruits, this is an impressive wine. Aged for 18 months in wood, it is a special selection that brings out rich fruits, a ripe structure and some aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2011 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Fleurie)

description: A fruity style, not powerful but bright, with some rich strawberry jam flavors. It has an edge of tannins as well as spice, dried fruits and a cool, soft aftertaste.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Domaine Mont Chavy  (Morgon)

description: The high elevation of Chiroubles has produced a crisp, cool and stylish wine. It has juicy cherry fruit and bright acidity. The wine is developing quickly and will be ready to drink from early 2017.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2015 Chatenay  (Chiroubles)

description: This is a structured, fruity wine, with red cherry flavors that go well with the drier edge of tannin. It has a layer of acidity that cuts through the ripe fruit showing a more ageworthy character. Keep this wine for 2–3 years, although with its fruitiness it can be drunk now.
title: Château des Jean-Loron 2010 Les Gandelins  (Chénas)

description: A wine with some structure, firm tannins and attractive black cherry and spice flavors. The wine has good weight and a dense texture that promises medium-term aging.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine de Lafayette  (Brouilly)

description: With ripe fruits and balanced tannins, this wine is developing well. It has generous berry flavors, ripe black currants and refreshing acidity. The tannins are still prominent and need to soften. Drink from late 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine des Pontheux  (Chiroubles)

description: This is a wine that comes from a parcel of 15 acres, grown on pink granite rock. Vines that are 67 years old have given this firm wine its concentration and density. Generous, full of black fruits, the wine is developing although it needs more time. Drink from late 2017.
title: Domaine de Grand Garant 2015 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)

description: A two-acre parcel of 75-year-old vines is the source of this jewel of a wine. It is ripe, full bodied and packed with dark fruits. The tannins and the structure promise some aging. Concentrated from the old vines and with a mineral, tight texture, the wine will take its time to be ready. Drink from 2018.
title: Les Frères Perroud 2014 Améthyste  (Brouilly)

description: A fresh, juicy wine that does everything a Beaujolais should. With its cherry fruit and bright acidity, it would be great with turkey. Enjoy it now.
title: Trenel Fils 2011 Cuvée Rochebonne  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a rich and full-bodied wine. While it is certainly packed with crunchy cherry flavors, it also has a more tannic and structured side giving it a firm texture to back up the fruitiness. The aftertaste is juicy and ripe.
title: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is soft and ripe, with red cherry and strawberry notes. It has a light tannic texture, with acidity and a broad, rich finish.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: This wine is all bright cherry fruit with juicy acidity and a jammy character. It's delicious now, with its light tannins and bright raspberry aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Vignobles des Roches  (Morgon)

description: This wine brings out all the fruitiness of Gamay, along with an extra perfumed character. It is soft, rounded and smooth, with cherry fruits and a touch of spice. Drink now.
title: Bulliat 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: With its fruit and acidity well in balance, this lively, bright wine shows fresh cherry flavors as well as some firmer tannins. The structure is light with fragrant aromas and a touch of spice. Wait until 2015 for this wine to be its best.
title: Trenel Fils 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Structured and still dense, this will need aging to bring out all the fruit. For now, it has a dark, textured character, full of tannins and minerality. It just hints at the juicy acidity that will follow. Drink from 2015.
title: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2012  Morgon
winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

description: This ripe wine has a full-bodied character that is then cut with acidity. It's juicy and fruity, with a good depth of flavor. The texture is firm, still young and needing until 2015 to age.
designation: Domaine de la Madonne des Loges
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine de la Madonne des Loges  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Ripe cherries dominate this rounded, full-in-the-mouth wine. An attractive smoky character enhances the red fruits and balanced acidity. The wine is developing, still young and fruity and bright with freshness at the end.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine des Trois Vallons  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: With rich fruits, this is a ripe and full-bodied wine. With ease and concentration, it handles considerable youthful acidity plus berry fruits and structure. It should be fully integrated by the beginning of 2015.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Flower Label  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Produced by a négociant based in Nuits-Saint-Georges, this is a ripe, Burgundian take on Beaujolais. This creates a full, plum and black cherry flavored wine where the tannins have been cushioned by the generous fruit. It does have the typical acidity and freshness of the year to give a lift. Drink now.
title: Vaucher Père et Fils 2014  Fleurie

description: From the famed slope of the Côtes de Py, this wine sums up both the great terroir and a great vintage. It has structure, with dry tannins permeating the ripe, rounded fruit. Its potential is considerable, anchored in great fruitiness and finishing acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Pizay 2015 Cuvée du Py  (Morgon)

description: Dense and structured, this bottling is made from selection of wines aged in large wood barrels for 12 months. Black cherry and plum fruits are balanced by firm tannins and backed by acidity. It is ready to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Pizay 2015 Les Sybarites  (Morgon)

description: From sand and granite soil, this firmly structured wine has dark tannins as well as the more familiar red-cherry flavors of Beaujolais. As it develops, it will become rich and fruity, juicy with good acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Les Déduits  (Fleurie)

description: This bright and fruity wine is made from Gamay, bringing out a cherry character as well as crisp acidity. The wine is lively, perfumed and ready to drink.
title: Château de Pizay 2016 Rosé de Soirée Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This ripe and creamy wine offers yellow fruits and a soft texture. The acidity is just right for all the rich fruit, giving a lift of citrus to the smooth texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2015 Bel-Air  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This rich, juicy wine is bursting with red fruits that are ready to drink. This is a ripe, full-bodied, friendly wine with just an edge of tannin and acidity to hold it all together.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2010 L'Héronde  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: This is a firmly structured wine, but its black cherry flavor is marred by banana sweetness. Otherwise the wine is solid and tannic, with light acidity on the finish. Age for a year.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Javernière  (Morgon)

description: This taut, structured wine achieves a balance between red berry flavors and dry, firm tannins. It has a herbal edge and a solid, dense texture. It powers through with intense acidity on the finish.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 La Madone  (Fleurie)

description: The wine comes from the Côte de Py, regarded as the finest site in Morgon. It has produced a rich mineral-textured wine. The structure is balanced by fine acidity and generous fruitiness. Red berries and cherry flavors are sustained by the firm tannins that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Lucien Lardy 2015 Côte de Py  (Morgon)

description: A ripe red-fruit note offers a perfumed character to this fruity wine. A touch of banana is the only quibble with what is otherwise a bright selection.
title: Pardon et Fils 2011 Domaine Pardon  (Fleurie)

description: A classic vinification in tank and barrel has produced a ripe, full-bodied wine. It has ripe cherry and dark plum fruits; layers of wood-aging flavors give a complete, dense and concentrated wine. It will age, drink until 2020.
designation: Château de Bellevue Climat les Charmes
title: Loron et Fils 2011 Château de Bellevue Climat les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: This is a finely structured wine that will age well. With black-plum fruits, layers of dark young tannins and balanced acidity, it is both juicy and full of great ripe swathes of fruit. From the cru estate that is owned by Louis Jadot in Beaune, it is impressive and worth aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château des Jacques 2015  Morgon

description: The wine comes from vineyards surrounding a stylish 19th-century chateau. With its bright red-berry fruit, the wine is crisp and only lightly structured. It is a cru wine to drink soon to appreciate its fruitiness.
title: Jean Loron 2015 Château de Bellevue  (Brouilly)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a soft cru wine full of cherry and red-berry flavors. It has an acid core firmed up by a smattering of tannins. Mainly though it is a lively, crisp wine that is ready to drink.
title: Maison des Bulliats 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

description: Produced from Henry Fessy's own cru vineyards, the wine is fruity and very accessible to drink young. Generous berry fruits and soft tannins make this an attractive wine. The aftertaste brings in light acidity. Drink now.
title: Henry Fessy 2015  Brouilly

description: This bright wine has red fruit and just the hint of structure. It is still young, still bursting with energy. The tannins will develop quickly to give a crisp, fruity wine. Drink from mid-2017.
title: Domaine des Marrans 2015 Corcelette  (Morgon)

description: Black-cherry fruit and a soft tannic structure give this wine its fruity but firm character. It has plenty of ripe generous fruitiness that is sustained by the acidity and by the solid core of the wine. Drink starting from 2017.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine de Rochegès  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This big, ripe, fruity wine balances its fruit with a core of firm tannins. It's dense, with a dusty texture, a sweet blackberry-jam flavor and final acidity.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Jean Descombes  (Morgon)
