description: Good structured fruit, with ripe sweet cherry flavors, appears alongside hints of raspberries. Fresh, but with some weight and solidity.
title: Château du Châtelard 2007 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: A tannic, structured wine, full of rich stone fruit flavors, with the acid hints of red berry fruits. It is fragrant and ripe with some depth and intensity.
title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2006 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas)

description: Vines on the slope of the Brouilly hill give a firmly structured wine. It is has a fine sense of balance between the tannins and the bright black-cherry fruits. Rich and crisp with acidity, it is going to be a wine that brings out so much fruitiness as it matures. Drink from late 2017.
title: Emmanuel Fellot 2014 Les Cailloux  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: Vines over 50-years-old give a concentrated cru wine. It is ripe with berry fruits topped by spice. Fruity and likely to develop quickly, it is an attractive wine to drink young from mid-2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine du Pourpre  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: While it misses out on the firmer side of the Morgon cru, this is a robust ripe wine. It has attractive red-cherry fruit and juicy acidity. The structure will allow it to age for a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Morgon)

description: A structured cru wine, full of firm tannins. It is a bold ripe wine with black-cherry fruit, a hint of banana and juicy acidity. The wine comes from a single 30-acre vineyard. Drink from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Structured and dense, the wine is dominated by its tannins. With a dry core and only the hints of real fruitiness, it is likely to take a while to develop. Final acidity provides hints of a fruitier future. Drink from 2018.
title: Terroirs et Talents 2015 Pierre Dupond Les Grands Cras  (Morgon)

description: The wine has tannins and a stalky black-cherry character. With a firm texture and balanced acidity, the wine is developing although it is not yet ready to drink. Wait until 2017.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Juliénas)

description: A cherry-flavored wine, this is all fruit with a bright layer of acidity and hint of tannins. Juicy and full of freshness, it needs a few months; drink from 2018.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2016 Belairissime Domaine des Ailes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Packed with strawberry aromas and red berry fruits, this is a ripe, fruit-forward wine only lightly disturbed by tannins. There is a great juicy quality here.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château des Bachelards  (Fleurie)

description: Ripe and also tannic, this is structured wine, its berry fruits pushing through a dry plum skin texture. It is solid and chunky while remaining fresh and fruity.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Château des Vierres  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Packed with juicy red cherries, this is a fresh, fruity Beaujolais to drink this winter. There is just a touch of tannin as well as refreshing acidity.
title: Domaine Pral 2009 Cuvée Terroir  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a soft, open wine, full of ripe berry fruits and red cherries. There is only the lightest tannin, along with bright acidity, a wine that is so ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Sélection  (Brouilly)

description: A solid, ripe wine, very much a nouveau for food, with some rich cherry fruit and an underlying smoky tannin layer. The fruit is ripe and full.
title: Mommessin 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is described as a natural wine with zero sulphite. It has a perfumed character with an earthy edge that comes from the carbonic maceration (whole bunch fermentation). With cherry fruits and bright acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Château de Javernand 2014 Indigène  (Chiroubles)

description: This Jadot is a combo of long-term contract vineyards and its Régnié Cru, demonstrating that knowing the terroir makes a difference. The blend shows well in this rich, full wine. It reveals ripeness—round and full of strawberry flavors from the 100% Gamay, with a tight layer of mineral acidity at the end.
title: Louis Jadot 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Aged 18 months in older wood barrels, this wine is bold and rich, while also stylish and balanced.The firm layer of tannins comes from the smoky wood aging as well as from the rich fruits. Concentrated and firm at this stage, the wine needs time. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2015 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Morgon)

description: Developed by winemaker Loic Bulliat, this wine comes from an estate owned by his family. It's structured, firm with tannins and juicy acidity. The wine needs aging to allow the tannins to integrate with the red-berry fruits. Drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Château des Roches  (Fleurie)

description: Full, ripe and smoky, this well-balanced wine has a dense texture to offset the bright red fruits and acidity. Spice, smoky flavors and a fresh red fruit aftertaste give a ready-to-drink feel.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The wine at this stage is all tannin. But you can feel the weight of red fruits underneath. It will develop as a serious wine, packed with both fruit and structure. Strongly mineral and with a dark texture, it has considerable aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2013 Grand Cras Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: This highly perfumed wine comes from a small Gamay appellation that is in fact in the Mâcon region. With some tight tannins and rich black fruits, it is a ripe, juicy wine that has intense acidity as well as a spicy aftertaste. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.
title: Château de Lavernette 2015 Le Clos  (Beaujolais-Leynes)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this soft, fruity wine is full of red-cherry fruits. It also offers a touch of banana flavor as well as acidity and a bright, crisp juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château de Lavernette 2016 Château de Lavernette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This crisp wine brings out good flavor depth from the cherry and red-berry fruits. It is concentrated for a simple Beaujolais, ripe and fruity, Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Prébende 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: There is no question about the wood here. It dominates the aroma and the palate, burying the fruit in a smooth, vanilla character. It is a pleasure to drink, but seems to have removed itself from Beaujolais.
designation: Cuvée Elevé en Fût de Chêne
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Elevé en Fût de Chêne  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Named after the French soldier who served under George Washington, this is an attractive, upright wine. Acidity and fresh cherries come through strongly along with a dry layers of tannins. It's likely to age at least a few more months, so drink from 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine de Lafayette  (Brouilly)

description: This is a ripe, fragrant, floral wine. A smooth texture is lifted by apple and peach flavors. Rich and full in the mouth, this creamy wine is ready to drink.
title: Lucien Lardy 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The wine has tannins and a firm dry texture. With bitter cherry and strawberry flavors, it is a solid wine that finishes with perfumed acidity. Drink now.
title: Louis Tête 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A comparatively serious Villages, its tannins firmly in evidence. There is a touch of woodiness as well. Only gradually does the red fruit come through. The aftertaste has fruity and acidity, but still those tannins.
title: Louis Tête 2008  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is Drouhan's second vintage of handling the vines, wines and marketing in partnership with the Hospices de Belleville charity. This open generous wine is packed with ripe red fruit and given shape by light tannins. There is a fresh crisp aftertaste that gives the wine a great lift.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2015 Hospices de Belleville  (Brouilly)

description: The estate is located to the north west of the village of Fleurie, further into the hills. The wine is structured and tannic with layers of red berries and tight acidity. It will need to soften for a few months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Henry Fessy 2015 Château des Labourons  (Fleurie)

description: A soft and fruity wine that has lively acidity and light tannins. The wine is finely balanced, full of red-cherry flavors. It's an immediately attractive, ripe cru wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine les Capréoles 2015 Chamodère  (Régnié)

description: From dark granite soil, this wine is structured and concentrated. It has ripe black-cherry fruit and spice that add to the mineral texture and firm tannins in the background. Drink this cru wine from late 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Saint-Amour)

description: This negociant wine is soft, ripe and smoothly textured. It has a fine balance between acidity and the rich red cherry fruit. With its edge of tannins, it has a good structure that gives it shape. Drinkable now.
title: Stéphane Aviron 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Structured, smoky and full of black cherry fruits, this is a wine whose appellation of Villages brings out just that extra bit of weight and richness. It's still fruity, ready to drink and fresh on the finish.
title: Henry Fessy 2014 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: If Nouveau could be serious, this would be it. It has weight, a surprising amount of richness and a structured, tannic character. It ranks in the food-wine category, while not at all detracting from its natural bright fruit aftertaste.
title: Antonin Rodet 2014 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a banana and red-cherry-flavored wine, that has a light tannic structure to contrast with the fruitiness. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Boischampt 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is a bright and fruity wine with attractive red-cherry flavors and light tannins. It has crisp acidity and a fresh aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)

description: The wine is light and instantly fruity. It has red fruits and soft acidity, giving an warm rounded aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2015 Automne Ensoleillé  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a refreshingly crisp and fruity wine. It has the lightest of tannins to shape the fresh red-fruit flavors. The wine comes from a 74-acre estate, owned by the same family for 10 generations.
title: Domaine Romy 2015 Vieilles Vignes Les Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)

description: The wine is tight with its red fruits dominated by acidity. It shows tannins and intense freshness that creates a bitter aftertaste.
title: Château du Châtelard 2015 Cuvée les Chalandières  (Beaujolais)

description: A richly aromatic wine, with swathes of sweet fruit, ripe tannins and a juicy, jammy feel. This is so generous, open, welcoming. There is structure as well, cushioned by the sweet fruits.
title: Henry Fessy 2009  Fleurie

description: Ripe, rounded and generous, a warm plum juice-flavored wine. There is power and concentration. It is a very complete, ageworthy wine, although accessible now.
title: Henry Fessy 2009  Saint-Amour

description: A wine that combines richness with a great structure. It is ripe, smoky, the red fruits rich and concentrated. A wine that is packed with juicy fruit and also with a good aging potential.
title: Château de la Terrière 2009  Moulin-à-Vent

description: A finely perfumed wine, touched with wood, Beaujolais in a Burgundy style, structured and with intense acidity. It is packed with firm tannins, surrounded by a lively cherry and rich fruit character.
title: Château des Jacques 2010 Clos du Grand Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Such a concentrated wine, with the intensity of red Burgundy but with the juiciness of Beaujolais. Swathes of smooth fruit wash around the palate, coupled with a touch of minerality and a dense texture. Age for 2–3 years and more.
title: Jacques Charlet 2009 Champ de Cour  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: These are definitely old vines, at nearly 100 years of age. The wine from this impeccable producer is juicy with great fruitiness and rich red-cherry flavors. It has fine acidity and light tannins. As befits a wine from Regnié, it is likely to age easily and with fine fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 Haute Ronze Vieilles Vignes  (Régnié)

description: Vines on the slope of the Brouilly hill give a firmly structured wine. It is has a fine sense of balance between the tannins and the bright black-cherry fruits. Rich and crisp with acidity, it is going to be a wine that brings out so much fruitiness as it matures. Drink from late 2017.
title: Emmanuel Fellot 2014 Les Cailloux  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: Old vines help give smoothness and concentration to this ripe wine. It has soft tannins, well integrated into the black cherry fruits, and acidity. With its spice and rounded texture, it is a wine to drink now.
title: Château de Pierreux 2012  Brouilly

description: Firmly tannic, this is a solid, chunky wine. It's full of dark plum, black currant and cherry flavors that fill out the firm, dry structure. Concentrated while also fruity, it's worth aging for a year.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Moulin à Vent  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: A weighty wine that has black fruits, solid tannins and richness. It has a dense layer of spice and fruit that has acidity as well as juiciness. Worth aging for 6–12 months.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2010 Hiver Gourmand  (Morgon)

description: A rich wine, with some weight, black cherry flavors and an edge of tannin. This is sufficiently structured to age, but the fresh fruit is all ready to appeal now.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Fresh and fruity, this is also a wine with some depth and concentration. Ripe, bright cherry fruits are layered with some firmer tannins as well as acidity. It's drinkable now although it will be better from 2016.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012  Moulin-à-Vent

description: Black fruits and rich tannins bring out the fruitiness. A strongly mineral character gives structure, while still allowing room for the red cherry and raspberry fruit flavors. It will age, so drink from 2016.
title: Fabien Collonge 2013 L'Aurore des Côtes  (Chiroubles)

description: Full, ripe and smoky, this well-balanced wine has a dense texture to offset the bright red fruits and acidity. Spice, smoky flavors and a fresh red fruit aftertaste give a ready-to-drink feel.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The wine at this stage is all tannin. But you can feel the weight of red fruits underneath. It will develop as a serious wine, packed with both fruit and structure. Strongly mineral and with a dark texture, it has considerable aging potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2013 Grand Cras Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: The wine is pure fruit, deliciously perfumed and with a rounded ripe character. It has acidity and structure although these are just supports for the bright fruits. The acidity at the end will allow it to age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Jean-Michel Dupré 2014 Le Griottier  (Morgon)

description: There is some of the structure characteristic of 2010 Beaujolais in this wine, but it is mainly dominated by a red cherry flavor and fresh acidity. It's ripe, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Jaffelin 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A soft, fragrant red-cherry flavor dominates this fruity, open and easy wine. Very ready to drink, it has attractive acidity and a light spice to the finish.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Château du Prieuré  (Brouilly)

description: This structured wine discloses dark tannins and a firm, dense character. The granite soil comes through strongly in the cool minerality and tight texture. It has weight and potential richness, but it does need to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Chiroubles

description: Smooth, creamy and round, this offers mango, peach and fresher grapefruit flavors, well integrated into its full-bodied texture. With its delicious rich feel, it has weight as well as final acidity.
title: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2013  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This is a bright, fruity wine made delicious by red berry flavors that come with a touch of spice and smoke. It has a good future, fresh and juicy while showing some structure. Drink now, but it will be better in 2015.
title: Domaine Dubost 2013 Tracot  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Ripe and delicious, this is full of fruit along with balanced structure. It is lively, with some youthful acidity as well as rich red berry flavors. It's ready to drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2012 Château du Grand Vernay  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: The wine is full of fresh fruits and crisp acidity. Alongside that, ripe plum skins and a mineral texture promise short-term aging. The old vines give concentration that adds a firm structure at the end.
title: Les Frères Perroud 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

description: From a single parcel that is above the emblematic windmill of Moulin-à-Vent, this wine shows its 16 months of wood aging in its smooth and perfumed character. Cherries and freshly ground spice mix with some firm tannins to give structure while leaving room for the fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2012 La Rochelle  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: There is a layer of tannins here that impart a dry edge to what is otherwise sweetly fruity wine. It is full and juicy, with strawberry fruit flavors.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: A fruity wine, full of red cherries and plenty of acidity. There is dry structure, making it food friendly, but the wine is not for aging.
title: Gérard Brisson 2010  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Good balance between crisp lemon acidity and ripe yellow fruits gives this wine a rich, fresh character that is delicious and stylish. Working from vineyards In the family for more than 100 years, the current producer, Jean-Paul Dubost, says “wine is never made by chance.” Drink now.
title: Domaine Dubost 2014 Cuvée Tracot  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Firm tannins show the structure and density of this wine. Dark plum fruits give a concentrated character that is cut by red-cherry acidity. Big and bold, this ripe while fresh wine needs to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Automne Festif  (Fleurie)

description: Jammy fruits are still kept in check by the dry tannins that surround this wine. It has a firm structure, intense acidity and black plum-skin fruit flavors. It's a serious wine, solid and certainly needing to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Hiver Gourmand  (Morgon)

description: While this structured wine has firm tannins, it also holds the potential of warm red-cherry fruits and acidity. It is concentrated, structured and ripe. Drink from late 2016.
title: Patrick Tranchand 2014 Coeur de Gamay  (Saint-Amour)

description: The wine shows very ripe fruits that are now at their peak. It is rich, rounded with touches of spice, toast and mature berries. The acidity is now totally integrated into this full-bodied wine that is ready to drink.
title: Château de Lacarelle 2011 Cuvée Grand Réserve  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Big and ripe, this is structured with fine acids, rich berry fruits and firm tannins. The ensemble is full bodied, juicy and elegant, finishing with crisp flavors of red cherry and pepper.
title: Château des Ravatys 2009 Domaine de l'Institut Pasteur  (Côte de Brouilly)

description: This selection is named after the cherry trees that border the vineyard, and it's not too much of a stretch of the imagination to find a red cherry flavor in the wine. Red berry fruits are there as well, backed up by dry, firm tannins.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2011 Les Cerisiers  (Juliénas)

description: A selection from parcels of vines in the La Rochelle section of Moulin à Vent, this wine comes from one of top recent vintages in Beaujolais. It is rich and packed with mature fruit. There are acidity, integrated tannins and secondary flavors of juicy acidity and smokiness. It is ready to drink. Owner Jean-Jacqus Parinet left the IT world for wine and bought Château Moulin-à-Vent in 2009 and Bief in 2012.
title: Domaine de la Tour du Bief 2010  Moulin-à-Vent
winery: Domaine de la Tour du Bief

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a warm, red-fruited wine. With plenty of acidity, it is fresh, although the big attraction here is the fresh fruit balanced by the firm, smoky tannins. Drink from summer 2016.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 La Chenevière  (Morgon)

description: Typically fresh and fruity, this strawberry-jelly flavored wine is light, ripe and soft. With fresh acidity and only a hint of tannins, it is ready to drink.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2012 Domaine Pignard  (Beaujolais)

description: Intensely juicy, this wine delivers tannins as well as red berry fruit flavors. Great acidity brings out a fresh side. The structure will push the wine forward and give it a good future. Drink from 2017.
title: Yohan Lardy 2013 Les Michelons  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Properly structured, this is a solid wine. Great swathes of plum fruits are partnered with firm tannins. It is dark and firm, with a dense character. Touches of chocolate and roasted coffee go with the rich plums. Drink from 2015.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Morgon

description: This serious wine is still very young. Its black fruits and firm tannins are showing considerable potential, with acidity and a firm core still developing. This will be a powerful wine and one that needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Pizay 2013  Morgon

description: This rich and full-bodied wine has spice, black fruits and smoky tannins all bundled together into a ripe structure. It's a complex, concentrated wine with finishing acidity that needs to age, so drink from 2015.
title: Domaine Dubost 2013 Cuvée Monthieux  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: From a traditional vineyard with old vines, this is a dense and structured wine. It has minerality, dark black fruits, a tense texture and a dry, tannic core. Drink from 2014.
title: Signé Vigneron 2012 La Passion  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Attractive and fruity wine with a twist of tannin over the juicy yet bitter cherry fruit. The wine has a sense of structure, firm and showing some wood as well as tannin. Worth aging another year.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

description: Despite its underlying richness, this is a very structured wine, solidly based on dry tannins and firm acidity. This texture, which is also given extra liveliness by its red cherry fruits, suggests a wine for aging over 2–3 years.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2009 Les Crots Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

description: A rich wine with spice and red fruits, the tannins well integrated. It shows aging potential both from its ripe fruit and its dry, firm core. The wine is very structured, powerful, a fine example of this exceptional vintage.
title: Jacques Charlet 2009 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: Sweet strawberry and cherry fruits are the soft cover to this intensely tannic wine. That structure shows its power, concentration and ageworthiness. Keep for three years and the richness will be fully revealed.
title: Lucien Lardy 2009  Moulin-à-Vent

description: With firm tannins, rich berry fruits and more typical red cherry flavors, this has weight and a ripe juicy core. It's ready to drink, but could be kept for another year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Named after the small grey lizards that are common in Beaujolais, this is bright and friendly wine. It is soft with red fruits and balanced acidity. Perfumed and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Château de Javernand 2014 Les Gatilles  (Chiroubles)

description: Very fresh, fruity and drinkable, this is a soft, red-cherry-flavored wine. Attractive acidity bursts out of the glass with a perfumed, tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Robert Perroud 2014 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: Light red cherry-flavored wine from a fine year for Beaujolais. The wine is all juicy fruit, rounded tannins and light, smoky acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2009  Beaujolais

description: Hints of smoky bacon and wood are now giving this wine some maturity. It has firm tannins still, but also a rich texture, with some red berries still present.
title: Château de la Terrière 2008 Cuvée de la Lure  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Tight and tannic, the wine reveals acidity, structure and red cherry juice flavors. There is a definite minerality here, giving the wine an austere feel. It needs a year or two to be at its best.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2010 Grand Cras Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: There is an austere character to this wine, tannins edged with minerality. It has weight as well as concentration and, as compensation, sweet cherry juice to go with all this structure.
title: Henry Fessy 2009  Chiroubles

description: A light and fruity wine with a slight tincture of tannin and acidity. Red-cherry and banana flavors dominate this readily drinkable wine.
title: Barton & Guestier 2015 Les Violettes  (Beaujolais)

description: From the heart of the Beaujolais Villages area south of the cru villages, this wine has a fresh feel to it. It is crisp with red cherry and lively acidity. The soft tannins just buoy up the wine and give it an attractive shape. Ready to drink now.
title: Cave du Château des Loges 2015 Prestige  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Gamay produces an attractive perfumed style of rosé, as with this wine. It has plenty of acidity balanced with raspberry fruit and a squeeze of lemon. It's ready to drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2015 Rosé de Soirée Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: From vines with an average age of 40 years old, this wine is the Duboeuf classic. It is soft, easy and fruity with its red fruits and gentle tannins. There is a dry edge to the wine, giving a touch of concentration. Drink this crisp wine now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Firm tannins make this wine solid and dry. It has banana and bright cherry fruits well integrated with the acidity. The aftertaste suggests the wine could benefit from a few more months before drinking, so wait until 2017.
title: Domaine Foretal 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A brand created by Pierre Ferraud in 1986, this is a ripe wine. It has red-cherry fruit that is rich and full of piquant flavor. The acidity goes through the fruitiness bringing a fresh aftertaste of red berries. Drink now.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2015 Cuvée des Montagnards  (Beaujolais)

description: Still rare to find in Beaujolais, this Chardonnay is a light wine, full of fruit and attractive ripe melon flavors. It has enough acidity for balance while being more ripe than fruity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château de Pizay 2015  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This soft wine is very fruity, with banana and red cherry flavors, and very drinkable now. It has a bright feel to it, from the acidity and from the light, jaunty texture. Drink now.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

description: Red fruit aromas, soft tannins and a warm feeling permeate this full, fruity wine. It has an open, generous texture, packed with cherry and red berry flavors and layered with acidity. The wine ends fresh and fruity with a touch of tannin.
title: Robert Perroud 2012 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: From 45-year-old Gamay vines, Stéphane Aviron created an open, fruity wine that has fresh cherry flavors cut with acidity and a dry edge of tannin. A smoky as well as juicy character adds interest and spice.
title: Potel-Aviron 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Chiroubles is highest of the Beaujolais cru villages, producing wines with good structure. This wine, with its firm tannins, shows some aging potential. It has acidity and ripe red-plum flavors over a dry core. Drink from 2017.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Eté Fleuri  (Chiroubles)

description: Highly perfumed, this exotic wine has a strongly textured, scented character that masks the fruit. Red berries underlie the dry texture along with acidity, giving the wine a fresh and fruity aftertaste.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2014  Juliénas

description: A smoothly ripe wine, with swathes of cherry and black currant fruits balanced by lively acidity. The wine, with its richness and the tannic structure, could well age for 3-4 years, although its fruitiness makes it delicious now.
title: Château de la Terrière 2009 Cuvée de la Lure  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Like many Beaujolais in 2010, this wine has a firm and tannic structure. Being Morgon, though, it also has power and richness, the black fruits intense, with acidity to balance. This could well age for 2–3 years and more.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2010 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: Made from the Domaine's oldest vines, this is a generous concentrated wine. With its ripe black fruits and firm tannins it is also a wine to age. It has perfumed black-cherry flavors that are enhanced and lifted by the acidity. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Domaine les Capréoles 2015 Diaclase  (Régnié)

description: A family-owned vineyard on this famous slope in Morgon supplies the grapes to Duboeuf for the wine. It is structured and dense, full of black plum and berry flavors. Acidity cuts through the tannins, resulting in a wine that will age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

description: Very fresh, fruity and drinkable, this is a soft, red-cherry-flavored wine. Attractive acidity bursts out of the glass with a perfumed, tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Robert Perroud 2014 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: Ripe and soft, this 100% Gamay puts its fruitiness right on display. It is fully packed with red currants that are sustained by light, mineral-textured tannins. It is ready to drink. Consider giving it a light chill in the summer. Thomas Collange, the eighth generation, has joined dad Bernard in running the winery.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2014 Tradition  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: While this Chardonnay is rich, it is also well balanced. It offers light spice, rounded yellow fruits and just a touch of minerality to give texture, plus toastiness to add interest. The end brings out the acidity.
title: Domaine des Marrans 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: From vines around the village of Lancié (near Moulin-à-Vent and Fleurie), this ripe, warm rosé is full of red-berry fruits that have raspberry and tangy bitter orange flavors. It's rich, spicy and a rosé for food.
title: Domaine des Nugues 2014 Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This wine is rich and gently textured with acidity under the red-berry fruits. Hints of fruit tannins balance the essentially juicy character of the wine. Drink from the end of 2015. Most of the Les Merrains grapes come from the Ferraud family estate in Vaux en Beaujolais.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2014 Les Merrains  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: More tannic structure than fruit at this stage, this is a firm, mineral-textured wine. A smoky, spicy character gives complexity, but also is still masks the red-currant fruits. Drink from 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Château des Déduits  (Fleurie)

description: While this wine does have structure, it also offers some lean fruitiness. Plum skins, banana and tight black-currant flavors dominate, cut through with acidity. The wine has structure and some potential. Drink from late 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine de la Roche Noire  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This is a very fine expression of this always richly structured appellation. It is still young, dominated by firm tannins as well as dark black fruits and the spice of wood aging. The acidity, the black cherry flavors and the density of the wine all suggest its great potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Grand Cras  (Morgon)

description: With its intense acidity, this wine is still too young to drink. It has plenty of fruit, a cool texture and a crisp, berry fruitiness. Give it until mid-2015 to round out and be less acidic.
title: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: While the wine is dominated by youthful acidity, it's red fruits and light structure promise an attractive future. It's fresh and very fruity, with spice and smokiness at the end.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2013 Perle de Granit  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a bright and fruity wine, fresh and full of strawberry, cherry and red stone fruits. Plenty of acidity is well integrated into the general fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2013  Beaujolais

description: This is a soft and perfumed wine, the red fruits hanging out easily with the acidity and gentle structure. It has a juicy character, hints of banana in the background and a fruity aftertaste.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2013 Les Merrains  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: There is a strong steeliness to this wine although it doesn't lose out on fruitiness either. Crisp apples are tempered with pineapple to give a ripe feel, while the end is fresh and mineral.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Structured and tight, this shows more texture and acidity than fruit. It has a hard edge that suggests extraction and gives a bitter, too-acid aftertaste.
title: Domaine André Colonge 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: In a firm style, this is a dense wine, its black fruits packed into a solid structure. It has power as well as ripe fruit, with tannins and acidity, and is likely to age for a couple of years.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2009  Morgon

description: Vinified without sulphur, this wine is all about fruit. It has red-berry flavors, ripe tannins and just the right amount of acidity to keep everything bright and fruity. The structure at this stage needs to soften and this fine, ripe wine will be better starting from 2018.
title: Lucien Lardy 2015 Les Roches  (Fleurie)

description: The aging potential of wines from this Beaujolais cru are apparent in this firm and structured wine. Dense with black fruits and with a mineral texture, it is a powerful wine from 70-yearold bush vines. The aftertaste with its acidity and dry edge confirms the aging, so drink from 2018.
title: Lucien Lardy 2015 Les Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Produced from a selection of old vines, this is a structured firm wine. Its black-cherry fruits and acidity are well integrated into the dense structure to give a spicy wine that is richly packed with fruits. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Domaine Chaintreuil 2014 La Madone Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

description: The Hospices is a charitable organization that has vines in Beaujolais. The wine is ripe with some tannins as well as red fruits. With its structure and concentration, it could age another few months, so wait until 2017.
designation: Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon
title: Collin-Bourisset 2015 Domaine des Hospices Civils de Lyon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: A fruity, forward wine with a touch of smokiness to go with the red cherry fruits and clear acidity. It's a full wine, structured with its background of tannins. The aftertaste brings out bright fruits.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine de Javernière  (Morgon)

description: A rich and rounded wine from a top Beaujolais vintage, this is ripe and full, packed with black cherry flavor and tannins that have now fully integrated into this warm wine. Drink now, although it could age longer.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Cuvée Prestige  (Juliénas)

description: The wine's name (“last breath”) is based on its origins in vines planted next to a cemetery. Putting that aside, the wine itself is impressive, richly structured and with dense tannins and concentration. The wine with its firm character and ripe black fruit will age. Drink starting from 2019.
title: Richard Rottiers 2015 Dernier Souffle  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: A selection from the oldest vines on the estate, this is a firm, ripe and concentrated fruity wine. Red cherries dominate the wine, lifted by the crisp edge of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château de Javernand 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

description: Firm and tight, this is a wine that is still shaking off its baby tannins. Open this a few minutes before drinking, and its fruitiness will pair well with food. The finish is bright with acidity.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Bel Air Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a soft, gentle and ripe Chardonnay by Laurent Perrachon, current winemaker from a Beaujolais family making wine since 1877. Lemon acidity is submerged by the warm apricot and white peach flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Mouilles 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Ripe red berries and a touch of red plum give this wine a full, fruity character. Light tannins add a suggestion of structure. It's juicy and ready to drink.
designation: Domaine de la Madone des Loges
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine de la Madone des Loges  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Ripe and caramel-flavored, this has fresh acidity supporting rich red-berry flavors. It's fruity, full in the mouth and round textured. Drink now.
title: Château de Chatelard 2014 Baronne du Chatelard Rosé d'Eté Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This wine is all crisp cherries and lively acidity. Only the lightest edge of tannin gives the wine some structure, followed by more fruit all the way. Drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2014  Beaujolais

description: This Chardonnay is soft, with attractive and gentle green fruit and sliced-apple flavors. A tang of lemon juice gives extra freshness.
title: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Tight acidity, cherry flavors and a hint of banana give this wine a light and fruity character. It has probably too much acidity for its own good, making it too crisp, missing out on richness.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Château de la Perrière  (Brouilly)

description: This wine is all about fresh cherries with only the lightest structure. It would be delicious drunk lightly chilled on a summer day.
title: Trenel Fils 2014 Cuvée Rochebonne  (Beaujolais)

description: This wine is crisp in character, with flavors of caramel and fresh red currants. The fruity tone provides a rich character that lies under the bright final acidity. Drink now.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2014 Vintage Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This textured, mineral Chardonnay has fresh apple and strong citrus flavors. It is lively, crisp and ready to drink. The producer is a member of Terroirs Originels of Beaujolais and Burgundy's Mâcon.
title: Domaine Emmanuel Fellot 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Light and fruity, this is full of strawberries. The wine has a fresh character with a light touch of pepper and spice. It's attractive, bright and ready to drink.
title: Château de Pizay 2014 Rosé de Soirée Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: Banana flavors spoil this otherwise attractive and fruity wine. A dry core of tannins is surrounded by creamed banana and red fruits. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is a surprisingly powerful wine, with (for a Beaujolais) a high alcohol. Densely textured, the wine is concentrated and dark with plenty of acidity as well as strawberry fruits. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.
title: Domaine Cordier Père et Fils 2015 Cuvée Juliette Louise  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a ripe and structured wine of red fruits and fine acidity. With its tannins and tangy edge, it has a dry core that gives it a great chance with food.
title: Domaine des Marrans 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This fine producer, based in Morgon, has made a rich and structured wine. With its perfumed red-berry fruits and balanced acidity, it is a savory wine that is ripe and ready to drink.
title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The wine has just the right density and weight for a Morgon. It comes from an 18-acre vineyard that gives a dark rich wine that is packed with tannins as well as black-cherry fruit. It is a complex wine, firm while also fruity. Drink starting from 2017.
title: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Corcelette  (Morgon)

description: Dark-hued wine, dominated by acidity as well as firm tannins. It shows solid, chunky structure, ripe fruit and plenty of sweetness. Of course, there is acidity as well, the charm of Gamay coming through in the fresh cherry flavors. Age 2–3 years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine Montchavy  (Morgon)

description: The rare ripeness of the 2009 vintage is shown in the high alcohol, for Beaujolais at least, of this wine. Not that it shows, except in weight. The acidity is right there along with ripe plums. An ageworthy, finely concentrated wine.
title: Paul Beaudet 2009 Clos de la Brosse  (Saint-Amour)

description: The 2009 vintage of this wine was one of the stars from Georges Duboeuf, and this 2010 fits the same pattern. It has great richness, spice, black cherry fruits, the acidity offering the fruity side of the wine. Ready for aging two years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine de la Chaponne  (Morgon)

description: A richly aromatic wine, with swathes of sweet fruit, ripe tannins and a juicy, jammy feel. This is so generous, open, welcoming. There is structure as well, cushioned by the sweet fruits.
title: Henry Fessy 2009  Fleurie

description: Ripe, rounded and generous, a warm plum juice-flavored wine. There is power and concentration. It is a very complete, ageworthy wine, although accessible now.
title: Henry Fessy 2009  Saint-Amour

description: From two different domaines on the Côte de Py slope, this is a dense, firm wine, very solid and powerful. The wine has opulence under its structure, with rich plum and sweet jelly flavors. Worth aging for another year.
title: Paul Beaudet 2009 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

description: From the smallest of the Beaujolais crus, this wine is structured, layering tannins with black fruits and acidity. It is a wine to age at least for a couple of years. Drink from 2018.
title: Henry Fessy 2015  Chénas

description: A solidly structured wine with fine tannins and ripe red-berry fruits. The acidity adds a piquancy to the fruitiness giving the wine a lift. The wine comes from Henry Fesse vines. Drink from late 2017.
title: Henry Fessy 2015  Chiroubles

description: An attractive, lightly structured cru wine that has juicy cherry fruits. It is balanced, ripe with acidity and gentle tannins in equal measure. Drink from late 2017.
title: Henry Fessy 2015  Morgon

description: A rounded and soft wine that has juicy red fruits and gentle tannins. It just hints at a dry structure that will allow it to age for several months. Drink this attractive cru wine from late 2017.
title: Henry Fessy 2015  Saint-Amour

description: Flavors of banana and red berry come with some tannin. This exudes vibrant, in-your-face fruit that's crisp and juicy.
title: Mommessin 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This is classic and fun, bold and fruity, with weight coming from the firm tannins. Pair this with food.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: For a wine meant to be consumed now, this is almost too tannic. It has bright fruit and a flavor of black currant skin, plus a dry, tannic core.
title: Albert Bichot 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: The power and complexity of wines from the slope of the Côte de Py is very evident in this wine. Densely argued, it is a solid wine with red fruits and a strong minerality from the volcanic soil. The acidity and tannic structure promise aging, and the wine will be best drunk from 2016.
title: Château des Jacques 2012 Côte du Py  (Morgon)

description: A dark and dense wine that has solid tannins and tight, juicy acidity. Its texture is very mineral, firm, complex and still needing to age. From a single vineyard in Morgon, it offers the powerful side of a Beaujolais cru, powered both by fruit and by structure. Drink now.
title: Château de Bellevue 2009 Le Clos  (Morgon)

description: A firm and tannic wine that brings out a fine, solid structure and concentration from old vines. Power and fruitiness are allied to a dry core of tannins that give a style and shape to the wine. This is a wine to age, so drink from 2015.
title: Richard Rottiers 2012  Moulin-à-Vent

description: From one of the properties where Duboeuf does vinification and bottling at the estate, this is a dense and structured wine. While it does have intense, young acidity, it also offers ripe berry fruits that are bold and rich. Drink from 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Château des Poupets  (Juliénas)

description: A red-fruited wine, this is a bright and crisp selection from the lightest of the Beaujolais cru villages. Its acidity cuts through the soft fruit flavors, and it has touch of tannin. Ready to drink.
title: Château de Pizay 2011  Régnié

description: Ripe and fruity, this is full of red cherry fruit. It has a mineral-driven structure that gives it a firmly textured edge and brings out the acidity. This could age for several years.
title: Château du Châtelard 2011 Cuvée les Vieux Granits  (Fleurie)

description: Named after a Roman centurion rather than a god of love, Saint-Amour produces structured Beaujolais. With its solid tannins and firm structure, this wine proves the point. It is concentrated, with acids and minerally red fruits dominating at the moment. It needs to age for 1–2 years.
title: Trenel Fils 2010  Saint-Amour

description: For a Nouveau, this has surprisingly structured fruit, with some firm tannins. It has a juicy cherry flavor and ripe acidity, with a tangy, textured finish.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Light, freshly red cherry-dominated wine. The light tannins are a background to the acidity and the fresh fruit. Easy style of Beaujolais.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Flower Label  (Juliénas)

description: A textured, structured wine, solid and packed with tannins. It is full of concentrated black currant and prune flavors, layered with dark coffee. It is worth aging for at least 1–2 years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine de Montchavy  (Morgon)

description: With some tannins, even a touch of wood, this is a weighty wine, giving juicy plum flavors along with acidity. It is rich and concentrated, although ready to drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Prestige  (Brouilly)

description: A wine with an important structure, tasting very young at this stage. There is great acidity through a lovely, fragrant, forward wine. The acidity gives everything a lift of fruitiness.
title: Mommessin 2010 Les Pêchers  (Saint-Amour)

description: This is ripe, full bodied and delicious, with a red fruit flavor. It has all the juicy fruitiness that is associated with Beaujolais. Drink now, even slightly chilled.
title: Château de Pizay 2011  Beaujolais

description: A ripe, smoky wine, full of sweet jelly berry fruit. It is rounded and rich, a delicious wine that rolls easily around the mouth.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Clos des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

description: With rich cherry fruits and a firmer underlying structure, this is a dense wine. It is still fresh and fruity but has also developed a broad, generous feel that gives weight. It is ready to drink.
title: Château des Gimarets 2011  Moulin-à-Vent

description: With flavors of wood aging in the background, this is a rich while structured wine. It has firm tannins, spice and layers of acidity that come from the mineral texture. Drink this ripe and concentrated wine from 2016.
title: Yohan Lardy 2013  Fleurie

description: Properly structured, this is a solid wine. Great swathes of plum fruits are partnered with firm tannins. It is dark and firm, with a dense character. Touches of chocolate and roasted coffee go with the rich plums. Drink from 2015.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Morgon

description: Produced from two separate vineyards, the wine has all the concentration of old vines. It has tannins and dark fruits, blackberry and black plum. This is a finely structured cru wine that will need to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Stéphane Aviron 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)

description: A blend from different parts of the Fleurie appellation, this wine is elegant and floral. Crisp red fruits are sustained by acidity and by a juicy character. As often with this appellation, it is a wine to age and will be better from 2018.
title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 La Chanaise  (Morgon)

description: A ripe and fruity wine with rounded tannins and fragrant acidity. The wine is juicy with red berries while soft at the end. It's delicious now, and will be even better from 2015.
title: Domaine de Boischampt 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Smooth and round while also fruity, this is packed with cherry and fresh plum flavors. It has a rich texture, full and juicy, the acidity giving just the right amount of freshness. Drink now, or age until 2015.
title: Domaine Dupré 2013 Vignes de 1940  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This superrich wine has luscious plum fruits, cushioned tannins and a ripe character. Full black cherries bring out the density and the solid backdrop. It can be drunk now, but will be better from 2016.
title: Henry Fessy 2012  Moulin-à-Vent

description: This is significantly young, tight and firm. Coming from one of the best sites in Fleurie, it has structure and tannins that dominate the rich red cherry fruits. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Chaintreuil 2013 La Madonne  (Fleurie)

description: Although 2013 was a difficult vintage, some of the top cru wines are successful. That's the case here, with a wine that is structured and with plenty of juicy fruit. The tannins are firm, although leaving room for the cherry juice fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château des Gimarets 2013  Moulin-à-Vent

description: Although 2013 was a difficult vintage, some of the top cru wines are successful. That's the case here, with a wine that is structured with plenty of juicy fruit. The tannins are firm, although leaving room for the cherry juice fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château Frédignac 2013  Moulin-à-Vent

description: In 2012, Pizay made two whites: one labeled Burgundy and this one labeled Beaujolais. This is more in the apéritif style, fresh and fruity, full of apple flavors and with a touch of citrus at the end. It's ready to drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2012  Beaujolais Blanc

description: From vines around the medieval castle, this wine has brilliant cherry flavors that give fruitiness and balancing acidity. There is a refreshing juicy character that is sustained by the subtle touch of tannin. Drink the wine now.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Château de Chanzé  (Beaujolais)

description: Produced from vineyard around the 13th-century castle, the wine has concentration, rich tannins and ripe berry fruit. Pepper and spice bring out the texture of the wine that is freshened by acidity.
title: Château de la Terrière 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Nuits Saint-Georges based Liger-Belair has produced a very Burgundian Beaujolais. It is full, structured and rich, now reaching its peak. Great cherry fruits allied to intense acidity are balanced by mature tannins and a firm, dense texture. The wine is ready to drink, although it could still mature further.
title: Domaine du Comte Liger-Belair 2009 Les Rouchaux  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This is solid, rich and with great fruit flavors to complement its structure. Red cherry fruitiness is lifted by intense acidity and broadened by the dark tannins and concentration. This is a wine to age for a few years, so drink after 2015.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2012 Grand Cras  Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: Structured and dense, this has a solid feel to it that still preserves its attractive, fragrant character. Black plum notes provide a twist of acidity as well as a perfumed finish.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Sélection  (Juliénas)

description: The northernmost Beaujolais cru of Saint-Amour is also the smallest, giving wines that are structured like this. It is a firm wine, made from 55-year-old vines (his youngest vines, says the producer) and with density as well as smooth red-fruit flavors. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Patrick Tranchand 2015 Coeur de Gamay  (Saint-Amour)

description: This powerful, single-vineyard wine is both fruity and structured. Dense tannins and dark cherry fruits are beautifully balanced with the wood aging. Wait to drink this wine until 2017.
title: Château des Jacques 2012 Clos du Grand Carquelin  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This single-vineyard wine is structured and dense. Powerful tannins come both from fruit and from wood aging. Underneath the black cherry fruit and fresh acidity are developing. Drink this complex wine from 2016.
title: Château des Jacques 2012 La Roche  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Typically young and fruity, this wine is packed with fresh cherry fruits and plenty of acidity. It's almost crisp and should be drunk now.
title: Château de Pizay 2013  Beaujolais

description: This is a structured wine, solid with tannins as well as ripe red berry and dark cherry fruits. The combination gives a wine that has concentration from old vines on sandy soil as well as the potential to age. Drink from 2016. The handsome château was an important fortified structure when the Lords of Beaujeu were defending themselves in the 12th century.
title: Loron et Fils 2014 Cheateau de la Pierre  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This estate wine from Château Moulin-à-Vent comes from a selection of different vineyards. It has a very direct, structured character, firm with tannins and ripe with delicious berry fruits. It is developing well, still structured and needing some time. Drink from 2017.
title: Château du Moulin-à-Vent 2012  Moulin-à-Vent

description: Granit is the sandy granite hillside soil of northern Beaujolais. The vineyard is a neighbor to the Fleurie appellation. This textured wine is rich with cherry and red-currant flavors that are rounded out and have just hint of tannins. The wine could soften even more so wait until early 2016.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2014 Perle de Granit  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: All juicy fruit, this is a bright, dry wine with delicious acidity that gives freshness. It also has a mineral edge, giving the red berry fruits a firm texture. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2016.
title: Fabien Collonge 2014 L'Aurore des Côtes  (Chiroubles)

description: A perfumed wine, it has structured black fruits and a solid texture. It is rich, showing complexity through its tannins along with acidity and fruitiness. Still surprisingly young to taste, it should not be drunk until 2015.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2011 Réserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Morgon)

description: Produced by a négociant based in Nuits-Saint-Georges, this is a ripe, Burgundian take on Beaujolais. This creates a full, plum and black cherry flavored wine where the tannins have been cushioned by the generous fruit. It does have the typical acidity and freshness of the year to give a lift. Drink now.
title: Vaucher Père et Fils 2014  Fleurie

description: This single vineyard wine is powerful with its concentrated tannins and dark cherry fruits. Good acidity goes with the fruit and the dry core. A shame that a hint of banana spoils the aftertaste.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

description: Beaujolais Blanc is effectively Burgundy-type Chardonnay but from the southern neighbor Beaujolais region. This wine, with its ripe and creamy texture, has the same rich character as a Mâcon wine. It is smooth and soft from a warm vintage for white wines. Drink this wine now.
title: Château de Lavernette 2015 Les Vignes de la Roche  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: The ripe fruit of this vintage is right up front in this strawberry and spice-flavored wine. With a texture that adds a touch of tannin to the fruitiness, it is smooth and round. Drink this aromatic wine from 2018.
title: Château des Loges 2015 Sélection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This has a mineral structure that's laced with acidity and red currant flavor. It has a tight texture and a crisp feel, showing a serious, austere side of Beaujolais. It's all balanced by the bright, crisp finish.
title: Trenel Fils 2010  Chiroubles

description: Banana and ripe red-berry flavors are attractive and bright. It has a slight raw edge due to its youthfulness, but it would make for a juicy apéritif if lightly chilled.
title: Paul Durdilly 2012 Les Grandes Coasses Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This has juicy cherry and banana flavors, plus smoky tannins that give this wine a structure that's unusual for Beaujolais Nouveau. The acidity is just right, lending the finish freshness.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: As fresh and fruity as any Nouveau should be, this also comes with a tang of black-currant-skin-like tannin as well as red cherry fruit.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This has an intense aroma that's almost overpowering, leading to a wine that is firm and dry. Its red cherry flavor is dominated by dense tannins. The perfumed character, joined by acidity, remains on the finish.
title: Pardon et Fils 2011 Domaine Pardon Cuvée de l'Ermitage  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Full, ripe and fruity, this is Nouveau upfront. It has a delicious juicy character thats sustained with some tannins. It has a bright, crisp finish that's flooded with a cherry flavor.
title: Signé Vigneron 2012 Domaine de Rochecorbière Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This wine impresses with its richness and ripe red fruits. It comes from a 20-acre vineyard that gives the wine concentration and juicy acidity. Acidity and the crisp aftertaste give the wine its final lift.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2016 Cuvée du Colombier  (Morgon)

description: Produced by Dominique Piron in association with the Lameloise family, this wine from strong granite soil reveals a firm texture and dense tannins. The fruit suggests very ripe, concentrated black plums and damsons. It is wine to age, drink from 2019.
title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Quartz  (Chénas)

description: A powerful and concentrated wine that has solid tannins and a tight, firm structure. It comes from heavily granitic soil, giving a steely texture that will take time to soften. As the red cherry and plum flavors develop, it will broaden out impressively. Drink from 2016.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2013 Côte de Py Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: Simple and fruity, this has berry flavors that mingle with floral acidity, soft tannins and a rounded texture. Ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine Paradis  (Saint-Amour)

description: This wine, solid and dense, is full of firm tannins as well as red cherry fruits. It's also fruity, with a great juicy character that permeates right through the wine. For drinking now, but better kept for 2–3 years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Domaine de Lavernée  (Chiroubles)

description: An elegant wine, its berry fruits fitting well into a structure that balances tannins and soft acidity. It has style, the fruit full of sweet black berry juice and a lift of acidity.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2009 Domaine du Paradis  (Saint-Amour)

description: Wonderful old vines facing south and south-east give a powerfully tannic, structured wine. They also give great black fruits, spice and a toasty edge from the wood aging. This is a dense wine with a serious future. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaines Dominique Piron 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This wine is fresh, bright and light, with citrus and ripe yellow fruits. Crisp, light and aromatic, it's ready to drink.
title: Château des Jacques 2013  Beaujolais Blanc

description: The wine is all about fresh apples and pears, with just a hint of smokiness and mineral texture. Crisp, with great acidity, it's ready to drink now, bright, full in the mouth and very fruity.
title: Château de Chatelard 2013  Beaujolais Blanc

description: The wine is soft, rounded and lightly perfumed. A smoky character brings out ripe cherry fruits and a soft texture. Spice and acidity contrast with each other at the end.
title: Château de Lacarelle 2012  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The wine has a light color, with fresh acidity and lively touches of raspberries. It is a delicate, crisp wine to drink now.
title: Domaine des Nugues 2013 Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: A soft, ripe wine with peach flavors, it has an attractively rich feel that is balanced by citrus and apple acidity. Very fruity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Gérard Charvet 2013 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: There is a strong cherry-juice character to this wine. It's ripe, young and very drinkable now. But with the underlying tannins, the wine should be able to age to bring out the structure and acidity.
title: Jaffelin 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Seriously structured, this is a powerful and tannic cru wine. It has a dry firm core that is guarding the blackberry and cherry fruits. As they develop, the wine will become riper and richer. Wait until 2019 to drink this long-term wine.
title: Jean-Pierre Large 2015 Les Délys  (Morgon)

description: This is a serious, complex cru wine from Jacky Janodet. It is full of structured tannins and rich black fruits. It is a wine that will age with its dry core and layers of acidity. There is a brighter element to this impressive wine that keeps the aftertaste juicy and crisp. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine les Fines Graves 2015  Moulin-à-Vent

description: From the Ferraud family's estate in Vaux en Beaujolais, this wine is ripe and full bodied. It has a touch of pepper as well as raspberry and red-currant flavors. Lively and full of fruitiness, it is ready to drink.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2015 Les Merrains  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a bright, cherry-flavored wine. It has an attractive tannic edge to the ready-to-drink fruitiness. The acidity at the end gives the wine a good lift.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014  Beaujolais

description: Banana flavors spoil this otherwise attractive and fruity wine. A dry core of tannins is surrounded by creamed banana and red fruits. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Light and fruity, this is full of strawberries. The wine has a fresh character with a light touch of pepper and spice. It's attractive, bright and ready to drink.
title: Château de Pizay 2014 Rosé de Soirée Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: Red fruits and banana aromas lead to a wine that has a lightly tannic touch over bright cherry fruits. Intense acidity and a herbaceous character come from grapes that are barely ripe. Drink now.
title: Château de Chatelard 2014 Cuvée les Chalandières  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a soft wine, light and fresh. It has a citrus character, lemon squeezed over apples that give crispness. Some minerality to the texture adds interest and puts the wine in the food-friendly category. Drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This Chardonnay from Marcel Grillet's horse-plowed biodynamic vineyard called Pizay is still very young, showing a candy, confected flavor that needs to calm down. It has the potential for attractive fruit from 2016.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2014  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This wine is lean, based more on acidity and structure than on fruit. It has hints of red-cherry flavors although they ought to be more developed. It leaves a smoky aftertaste.
title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: With its bright pink color and fruity acidity, this is a candy-flavored, crisp wine. It is as bright in its flavors as it is in its color. It is light and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2014 Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This young, fruity wine is soft and fresh with acidity. It is light, rounded and, with its red-cherry flavors right to the fore, ready to drink. Pierre Ferraud created the wine in 1986 to show that a simple red Beaujolais is not just nouveau.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2014 Cuvée des Montagnards  (Beaujolais)

description: With intense banana aromas, this is a tight wine with high acidity. It has crisp red-currant fruits that are not quite ripe. Tangy and shot through with banana flavors, the wine will be better from 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine des Darroux  (Chénas)

description: This is a soft, rounded and ripe wine. Attractive raspberry fruits are filled out with a light tannic character. The freshness and acidity do cut the full texture although perhaps not enough. Drink now.
title: Jean-Paul Brun 2014 Rosé d' Folie Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: A classic and fun Nouveau, this has an extra side of firm tannin that adds weight to an otherwise bold, fruity and food-friendly wine.
title: Thorin 2012 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Juicy and soft with just a touch of tannin, this is all about red cherry fruits. A rounded texture makes the wine ready to drink.
title: Trenel Fils 2014  Côte de Brouilly

description: Ripe and jammy, this is an immediately attractive wine. Warm crushed-strawberry flavors have enough tannin and acidity to keep freshness. This wine can be drunk now, although it will be better, with softer tannins, from 2016.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

description: From the village of Lantignié, rosé from this 1,300-foot elevation vineyard is fresh and light-hearted. Full of ripe strawberry flavors, the wine also has great acidity, giving a direct and fruity wine that is ready to drink.
title: Château de Basty 2014 Lantignié Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: With a light layer of tannin, this structured wine comes from the heart of the Beaujolais Villages area. It has black cherry and red-fruit flavors balanced by the right amount of acidity. Drink now. The Colonge family has been growing grapes in Beaujolais since 1789.
title: Domaine André Colonge 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is a ripe and juicy wine with fine tannins and a swathe of black currant and cherry fruits. It bursts from the glass, fruity and with bright acidity. It is classic, ready-to-drink Beaujolais.
title: Domaine de Colette 2014 Coteaux de Colette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine, while so fresh and fruity, also has some weight behind it, giving ripe plum and black-cherry flavors. A tannic texture behind the wine balances with the final acidity.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2014 Les Griottes  (Beaujolais)

description: This aromatic, red-cherry flavored wine demonstrates the freshness of the year and the grape. It's a finely textured wine that is structured and accessible, with firm, dry tannins. It can be aged for 2–3 years.
title: Lucien Lardy 2011 Les Chênes  (Fleurie)

description: Full of firm tannins, this Juliénas shows solid structure and ripe red fruits. The fine acidity should help the wine age, and the juicy, fruity character should appear after a year or more.
title: Trenel Fils 2010 Esprit de Marius Sangouard  (Juliénas)

description: The famed Côte de Py Vineyard in Morgon has made a powerful and structured wine, with a black cherry flavor that's shaped by the dry, firm tannins. It is concentrated, dense and generous, with strong minerality and gritty texture. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2011 Le Py  (Morgon)

description: Broad, open wine with berry fruits, black cherries and a soft texture. The wine has freshness, plenty of acidity, for drinking now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2008 Séléction  (Juliénas)

description: Of all the Beaujolais crus, Morgon is the one for aging. This wine, with its powerful structure, exemplifies age-worthiness. It is weighty and dense, with a solid feel, plus juicy, opulent fruit that helps to balance the wine. Keep for 3–4 years.
title: Château de Pizay 2011  Morgon

description: This is big Fleurie, dominated by floral aromas and dry tannins at this stage, and therefore likely to develop for a year or two. The fruits are dark plum, full in the mouth. The acidity offers freshness but also adds to the weight of the texture.
title: Signé Vigneron 2008 Château des Moriers  (Fleurie)

description: Ripe and jammy, this offers juicy red berry and plum fruits. It has a dense character with tannins giving shape to the attractive, ready-to-drink fruitiness.
title: Jean-Paul Brun 2014 Cuvée Première de Jean-Paul Brun  (Beaujolais)

description: While there are banana aromas, the palate is rich with red fruits and ripe tannins. This wine is soft and fruity, although a tight line of acidity cuts through. The wine will be better from 2016.
title: Les Frères Perroud 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

description: Tight and crisp, this wine is laden with acidity as well as dry tannins. The fruit element is still developing, hints of red berries beginning to come through. It's a wine to age for several months, so drink from 2016.
title: Pascal Berthier 2014 Esprit de Séduction  (Saint-Amour)

description: This tight and mineral wine reflects the granite terroir on which it is grown. It was made with semi-carbonic cold maceration without addition of yeast or SO2. The fruit is still lean and needs time to round out and balance the acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Christophe Pacalet 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Ripe and spicy, this wine has delicious white fruit, nutmeg and fresh lemon flavors. It is light in character, with the fruit and acidity giving delicious lift. Refreshing and with great fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Thulon 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is a beautifully fresh wine, as crisp as possible. It is light in character while still bright with red berry fruits. The acidity and the general fruitiness give a refreshing aftertaste. These are young vines so we will see what the future brings.
title: Domaine des Marrans 2014 Gamay (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This fresh, cherry-flavored wine is full of fruit. It has bright tones, highlighted by acidity and a crisp texture. This is a wine to drink young, still fruity and perfumed.
title: Domaine Rochette 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: These ancient vines provide a rich and succulent wine. Ripe black cherries and rich fruit are enhanced by the tannins and concentrated texture. It is a wine that will age, although it is ready to drink. Drink until 2022.
title: Jean-Michel Dupré 2015 Vignes de 1940  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: You can taste the wood in this red, fruity wine. It gives a spicy character to the cherries and red currants, adding both complexity and the potential for aging. The end shows the fresh acidity of the year.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Château des Capitans  (Juliénas)

description: This is a sweet and fruity wine, full-bodied and ripe. It has red cherries and bananas along with some acidity. While there are some tannins, it's meant for immediate drinking and not for aging,
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012 Léon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This dry wine offers light fruitiness and more in the way of caramel flavors and structure. It's textured, full in the mouth and very much set out for food.
title: Domaine du Penlois 2013 Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: Full of cherry and banana freshness, this is a simple wine that shows attractive fruit and acidity. It is good to go now, light, fragrant and bright.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Coeur de Presse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a fruity wine with cherry fruits and a soft, juicy texture. It's lively and fresh, with good acidity at the end.
title: Henry Fessy 2013  Beaujolais

description: A ripe, fleshy wine, full of cherry notes and spice. It is rich, full in the mouth while keeping a light fruitiness that allows it to develop fast. Overpowering banana flavors at the end spoil the overall effect.
title: Louis Jadot 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: While the acidity is intense, it is balanced by the ripe cherry fruits and soft tannins. This is not a wine for aging much beyond 2014, showing a bright, fresh aftertaste.
title: Domaine de Roche Guillon 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Lean and firm, the wine has a dry, tannic layer that is emphasized by a burnt, smoky character. The fruit needs time and is likely to be austere.
title: Gérard Charvet 2013 La Réserve d'Amélie  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: Light in color, but rich in fruit, this wine has structure, spice and ripe red cherry fruits that are kept from total exuberance by the layer of young tannin. The wine should age; drink from 2016.
title: Château des Jacques 2012  Moulin-à-Vent

description: From one of the leading estates in this cru appellation, the wine is structured and firm and likely to age well. With black cherry and red-currant fruits it is crisp although with its solid texture it should broaden out. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Domaine Cheysson 2015  Chiroubles

description: Annick and Jean-Marc Lafont's three acres on the slopes below the chapel of la Madone give a firm and concentrated cru wine that will repay aging. There are layers of red-berry fruits that are cut with solid tannins and a dry core. The wine will age, so drink from 2018.
title: Domaine de Bel Air 2015 Granits Rosés  (Fleurie)

description: Although the Chermette family is based among the Beaujolais vineyards to the south, it does also possess vines in the crus villages of the north. With an open, ripe and juicy character the wine has concentration and richness. It is full, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2015 Pierreux  (Brouilly)

description: With some weight and attractive fruit richness, here is a wine that brings out all the red fruitiness of a Beaujolais cru, while not being unduly burdened with tannin or structure. Its fruitiness should be taken advantage of now.
title: Château de Pizay 2010  Régnié

description: A red fruit flavored wine, light and packed with acidity. The wine may not have the richness of the vintage, but it does have a fine line in red cherry flavors. Drink now.
title: Louis Chevallier 2009  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A soft wine, full of cherry preserve flavors, along with a bright, fresh waft of acidity. It is just spoilt by the banana flavor from the vinification.
title: Signé Vigneron 2008 Le Chat Rouge  (Beaujolais)

description: This crisp wine brings out good flavor depth from the cherry and red-berry fruits. It is concentrated for a simple Beaujolais, ripe and fruity, Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Prébende 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: Firmly structured, this is a rich wine in a style that is rounded and ripe. It has light tannins and spicy acidity to balance the general richness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This wine, bottled with minimum sulfur, is ripe with concentration and firm tannins. It is fruity although there is also a bitter edge to the ripe cherry flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2015 Natural  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This estate-grown wine has a really fresh character. With red-currant and red-cherry flavors, it has a juicy fruity style that is ready to drink. Light and perfumed, it is delicious now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Château d'Ouilly  (Beaujolais)

description: Griottes are a type of bitter cherry used in cooking, and this wine shares some of that character. It is firmly structured with acidity and an edge of attractive lightness. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Mommessin 2010 Les Griottes  (Morgon)

description: Smoky wine, rich as well as structured. The acidity of the year is integrated into the structure, the firm tannins and juicy red berry fruits a balanced pleasure to taste.
title: Richard Rottiers 2010  Moulin-à-Vent

description: Bright and fruity, this is a ready-to-drink wine. Fruitiness and lively acidity are balanced by the cherry juice flavors and a light structure to finish.
title: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2013 Le Buissy  (Beaujolais)

description: The wine is soft and fruity with attractive red cherry favors and light acidity. It's smooth, round and ready to drink, with lively acidity and a touch of tannin on the finish.
title: Louis Tête 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Surprisingly austere for a Beaujolais-Villages, the wine has a firm, dry character that hides the natural fruitiness of the Gamay. Dense tannins and acidity give a cool feel to this stalky wine. It has red fruits, intense and tight acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Louis Tête 2013 Les Combes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: A solid, structured cru wine with a fine line in tannins and black-cherry fruits. It is dense with a firm, dry core. Surrounding it are ripe fruits and acidity. A wine to keep a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Domaine des Vieilles Caves 2015  Saint-Amour

description: Gérard Charvet took over Rosiers from his father in 1983 and remains focused on the art of vinification. A percentage (30%) of wood aging has give this ripe wine its dense texture. That contrasts with the generous black fruits that are still developing. This is a serious, dense wine that will age. Drink from 2018.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine des Rosiers  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: With its high elevation, it is logical that Chiroubles produces some of the coolest Beaujolais cru wines. This is fruity with a tang of acidity and a mineral texture that is enhanced by a crisp character. The wine has light tannins and a final juicy finish.
title: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2015  Chiroubles
winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

description: The wine is soft and fruity with attractive red cherry favors and light acidity. It's smooth, round and ready to drink, with lively acidity and a touch of tannin on the finish.
title: Louis Tête 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Surprisingly austere for a Beaujolais-Villages, the wine has a firm, dry character that hides the natural fruitiness of the Gamay. Dense tannins and acidity give a cool feel to this stalky wine. It has red fruits, intense and tight acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Louis Tête 2013 Les Combes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Bright cherryade flavors give an attractive, herbal character. It's not sweet, although there is a suggestion of this. It finishes soft and round, and the wine is not likely to develop further.
title: Christophe Pacalet 2013  Beaujolais-Villages

description: From the famous Morgon hillside of Côte de Py, this is a firm and structured wine. It shows the aging possibility of a Beaujolais, rich and full of firm tannins that come straight from the granite soil.
